loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in medicinal plants for making natural medicines.

loans.name: Jose Jesus

texts.es: José tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia y humilde desde hace 11 años junto a su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar. Desde hace 10 años José se dedica a la venta de minutas, negocio que le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su familia, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con su fuente de ingresos, también  su compañera de vida le apoya económicamente gracias a su negocio de venta de pupusas. José quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, es por ello que José solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, hierro, arena y mano de obra para construir una pared de ladrillo en su vivienda ya que esta es de lámina y por la peligrosidad de la zona siente que no es muy segura, por lo que espera contar con el apoyo de este crédito lo antes posible.
texts.en: José is 42 and has lived in his own humble home for eleven years with his wife and family. For ten years, he has sold fast food. This business has allowed him to feed his family. He is happy to be able to count on this source of income. His wife also helps out with her business selling pupusas.  José wants to improve his home's conditions, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, iron, sand, and labour to build a brick wall in his home. The home is made of laminate, and the area in which they live is not very safe. He hopes to have this loan as soon as possible for this reason.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, iron, sand, and labour costs to build a brick wall for his home.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish for her business.

Sarah has been in this business for nine years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a banana vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Lorna is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her banana vending business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cirila is 52 years old and has three children who are in school.

Cirila has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cirila has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Cirila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with four children. She is 45 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessica has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and pay for other maintenance for her business.

Jessica has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for other maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Kalbubu

texts.ru: Калбубу, 68 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей  и уже 2 внуков. У Калбубу  высшее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Калбубу сейчас на пенсии, у нее большой трудовой стаж. Их совокупная пенсия составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS). Калбубу намерена провести дома ремонт, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку краски и строительных материалов. Свои доходы Калбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Kalbubu is 68 years old, married, and has four children and two grandchildren. Kalbubu has a higher education, and has very good testimonials from her neighbours. Kalbubu is now retired. She has a wide employment history, and their combined pension is about 11,000 som (KGS).

Kalbbu intends to conduct home repairs, thus she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS). This will help her to buy paints and building materials. Kalbubu plans to invest the funds in the further improvement of her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and paints for making some improvements in her house

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is 68 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Antonietta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Antonietta would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 66 years old and married with nine children. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Milagros has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 46 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are still in school.

Ruth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like canned goods, shampoo, noodles and school supplies.

Ruth has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from fishing and selling clothes.

Ruth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, shampoo, noodles and school supplies.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анара, 40 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она с 2002 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Анары на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, также 1,50 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает картофель и фасоль. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет до 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной 10 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Anara is 40 years old, married, and the mother of five children. As the main income provider for her family, from 2002 she has worked in animal husbandry and agriculture. Today, Anara has five cows on her farm, as well as 1.5 hectares of her own land, where she cultivates potatoes and beans. Her total monthly income comes to about 16,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Anara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS). This will help her to buy ten sheep for fattening up and reselling. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Lluvia De Bendicion Group

texts.en:
The small town of Cantel is to the east of the second largest city in Guatemala — Quetzaltenango in the Department of Quetzaltenango. It is about 7,000 feet in altitude. Cantel is known for its textile industry and is where the women make a large variety of fabrics and yarns in many different colors. It is here that the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Lluvia de Bendición” (Blessings of Rain) is located.

In July of last year, “Lluvia de Bendición” received its first loan cycle from Kiva lenders. The women report that the loan has been very beneficial in helping them to maintain and/or increase their business. Forty-three-year‐old Eva Encarnación is the president of “Lluvia de Bendición.” She also started her first loan cycle.

Eva plans to invest her loan in buying a variety of fabrics and yarns to create the beautiful huipiles (blouses) worn by the Maya women. She hopes that she will be able to increase her business, and thus, will be able to provide a better quality of life with more opportunities for her children.

Speaking on behalf of the other members of “Lluvia de Bendición,” Eva thanks the Kiva lenders from around the world for providing support, which helps the women have a better future for themselves and their community!

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics and yarns to create the beautiful huipiles (blouses) worn by the Maya women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a retaining wall at her house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be dynamic. He operates a photography business. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of photography items. His business goal is to have a large studio within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of photography items

loans.name: Serapia

texts.en:
Serapia is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. She sells onions, garlic, and tomatoes, which she has been doing for five years. Her husband works in a construction company. 

Serapia requested a loan, which she will use to buy supplies such as onions, tomatoes, and garlic. With the loan, she will improve the quantity of her stock and cater to the need of her buyers, thus increasing her income. Serapia will be able to support the needs of her growing children and expand her existing business for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as onions, tomatoes, and garlic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to put in a cement floor in his home.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is 63 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Amada requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as eggs, condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. Amada hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as eggs, condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Maximo Dionisio

texts.es:
Máximo siempre tuvo la esperanza de llegar a tener grandes terrenos para cosechar lo que aprendió desde pequeño. Ahora, después de diez años de montarse en ese tractor de la agricultura, ha conseguido lo que siempre había soñado. Él expresa lo bien que se siente de haber progresado y más en la última temporada que tuvo un préstamo con Kiva a través de MiCrédito y con el cual compró fertilizantes, abono, gasolina y líquido para enfrentar la plaga. Los resultados fueron exitosos por lo que se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que lo ayudaron con ese crédito. 
Actualmente está a punto de iniciar la nueva siembra, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar gasolina para la bomba de riego, abono y fertilizantes. Con esto logrará tener una cosecha de calidad y generar mayores ingresos para sustentar a su familia. Al cancelar pretende seguir trabajando en la siembra de tomate y chiltoma que tanto le ha brindado grandes frutos.
texts.en:
Máximo has always held the hope to come to hold large plots of land to harvest what he learned since he was small. Now 10 years after climbing on the tractor that is agriculture, he has achieved what he always dreamed. He expresses how good it feels to have progressed more so in the last season when he had a loan from KIva through MiCrédito with which he bought fertilizer, manure, gasoline and pesticides. The results were good so he feels very grateful with all the people who helped him with that loan.

Currently he is ready to start another season so he is requesting a new loan to buy gasoline for his irrigation pump, manure and fertilizer. Doing this he will manage to have a quality harvest and generate more income to sustain his family. On closing he is hoping to continue growing tomatoes and green chilies which have given him good results.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for his irrigation pump, manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tynchtykbek

texts.ru: Тынчтыкбек, 31 год, женат. У него высшее образование, уже 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Сегодня в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 0,44 Га занимается полеводством, выращивая картофель. Деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль около 10,000 сомов(KGS). Он обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. В будущем Тынчтыкбек планирует направлять доходы от кредита на развитие своей деятельности и постройку сараев.
texts.en:
Tynchtykbek is 31 years old and married. He has a higher education, and has worked in farming for ten years. Today there are two cows on the farm, and on the 0.44 hectares of arable land he owns he also engages in field husbandry, cultivating potatoes. The business brings a monthly profit of about 10,000 som (KGS).

He has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) so that he can buy one heifer to increase his livestock headcount. In the future, Tynchtykbek plans to direct the funds from the loan into the development of his business and into constructing sheds.

loans.use: to buy one heifer in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Miechelle

texts.en:
Miechelle is 34 years old, married and has three children to support. She wants to help her husband with the expenses of living and increase their family income, so she engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business to earn a living and be able to support their children's daily needs. 

She decided again to take a loan to buy additional goods for the store to sell and also increase her store inventory to make more sales.

Miechelle wants to save money for the future out of her business to renovate their house.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and items for the store to sell.

loans.name: Leng Group

texts.en:
Leng, the group leader, is 41 and widowed. She lives with her two grownup children in the Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. Leng earns $3 a day from selling groceries and she has been in the selling business for over three years. Her two children are workers in a peppercorn plantation and they can make around $10 a day. 

Leng and the other three members would like to request a group loan  They will use their own portions to buy foundation parts to build latrines. This loan will help all members live in better conditions. In the future, Leng is going to expand her selling business.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts to build latrines

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda is 59 years old and married with five children.

Bernarda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Bernarda has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Bernarda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 56 years old, married and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Concepcion has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Concepcion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 41 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Erlinda requested her fourth loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosa Martlin

texts.es:
Si de esfuerzo, valentía y amor por los demás se quiere hablar, Rosa es el mejor ejemplo que se puede presentar. Esta comerciante de 63 años de edad es viuda y es madre de nueve hijos, entre ellos dos son adoptados. Esta mujer esforzada trabajó desde los diez años intentando salir adelante con su familia, trabajó limpiando casas a los quince años y luego de tener cuatro hijos empezó a emprender vendiendo enchiladas y mangos en la calle. Poco a poco fue trabajando en otros proyectos comerciales hasta crear su propia pulpería. 
Rosa cuenta con el apoyo de todos sus hijos en su negocio, pues siempre han sido una familia bastante unida que han trabajado para salir adelante. Por esta razón es que esta emprendedora desea seguir invirtiendo en su pulpería, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar gaseosas, dulces, galletas, huevos, pan, entre otros productos para surtir su mercadería y tendrá mayores ingresos. En un futuro planea incursionar en el mundo de la venta de objetos de segunda mano para tener más ingresos y seguir mejorando el estilo de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
If hard work, bravery, and love for others could speak, Rosa is the best example that it could manifest. This 63-year-old merchant is a widow and mother of nine, some of whom are adopted. She is a hard-working woman. From the age of ten, she has been working to support her family. She cleaned houses for fifteen years and after having four children started to learn to sell enchiladas and mangos in the street. Bit by bit she has started other projects, until finally she created her own corner store.
Rosa counts on the support of all her children in her business. She has always had a very united family that works together to succeed. For this reason, she wants to keep investing in her corner store. She has requested a loan to purchase pop, candy, eggs, bread, and other products to stock her store and have a better income. In the future, she plans to start selling second-hand items in order to have a greater income and keep improving her and her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pop, candy, eggs, bread, and others.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 57 years old, married, and has 10 children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita has a fishing  business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Teresita requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
El mundo tecnológico es la vida de José, quien desde pequeño le apasionaban las computadoras y por ende decidió estudiar Ingeniería en sistemas para aprender más de este tema. Al graduarse, este joven de 26 años ya sabía para dónde iba a su camino por lo que emprendió hace más de un año en un negocio de cibercafé, alquilando por horas computadoras con internet que consiguió con préstamos y con la ayuda económica de su hermano.  
José sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo y agregarle a este mismo una librería para generar más ingresos, donde sus clientes se sientan a gusto y puedan encontrar todo lo que necesita. Por esta razón es que quiere seguir invirtiendo, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar una computadora y reparar otras que actualmente tiene. Esta inversión le ayudará a que sus clientes se sientas felices con el servicio y no tengan que esperar más tiempo. Ayuda a este emprendedor a este emprendedor seguir con su sueño.
texts.en:
The world of technology is José’s life.  He has been passionate about computers since he was little.  He, therefore, decided to study systems engineering in order to learn more about this subject.  Upon graduating, this 26 year old young man already knew where he was headed.  Over a year ago he undertook a cybercafé business.  He rents by the hour computers with internet that he got with loans and with financial help from his brother.

José dreams that his business will continue growing and that he will add a bookstore to his business.  He will do this to generate more income and so that his customers will be comfortable and able to find everything they need.

For this reason he wants to continue investing.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy a computer and to repair others that he currently has.  This investment will help his customers to be happy with the service and not have to wait longer.  

Help this entrepreneur continue on with his dream.

loans.use: to buy a computer and to repair others that he currently has.

loans.name: Edgard Antonio

texts.es:
Edgard a su corta edad tiene todas sus metas trazadas, con tan solo 27 años de edad, ya ha trabajado para una empresa y montó hace seis años una pulpería para generar sus propios ingresos y ser su propio jefe, siempre sin dejar sus estudios universitarios. Además alquila cuartos en su casa, con el apoyo de su esposa, quien también trabaja en otra empresa.
Siendo los dos jóvenes han salido adelante con mucha motivación y con grandes expectativas en su negocio, el cual sueña en convertirlo en una distribuidora. Por esta razón es que Edgard solicita un préstamo para comprar papel higiénico, jabón, gaseosas, desodorantes, alimentos enlatados, entre otros productos para amentar su inventario y generar más ganancias. En sus planes está ahorrar para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
Edgard at his young age has all his goals planned. At only 27 years old he already works for a company and six months ago opened his own store to generate his own income and be his own boss, all without leaving his university studies. He also rents rooms at his house with the help of his wife who also works in another company.

These two youths have gotten ahead through great motivation and have great expectations for the business. He dreams of converting it into a distributing center. For this reason Edgard is requesting a loan to buy toilet paper. soap.soft drinks, deodorants and canned goods amongst other products to increase his inventory and generate more income. Amongst his plans are to save to make improvements on his house.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper. soap.soft drinks, deodorants and canned goods amongst other products.

loans.name: Jose Marlon

texts.es: José tiene 27 años de edad  vive junto a su madre en vivienda propia desde hace varios años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder apoyar a su madre en su vejez. Él se dedica a la venta de productos básicos y bebidas, tiene 5 años de experiencia  en el negocio, por lo que cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos. José desea comprar un mueble adecuado para mostrar sus productos, pero además desea surtir más su mercadería, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frijoles, arroz, maíz, maicillo, bebidas como jugos, gaseosas y un mueble para mostrar los productos.
texts.en:
Jose is 27 years old and has been living with his mother in their own home for the past five years, and he feels happy to be able to support his mother in her old age. He makes a living selling basic products and beverages, he has five years experience in the business and, thanks to this, every day there are more and more clients requesting his products. 
Jose wishes to purchase an adequate cabinet to display his products, but he also needs to restock his merchandise which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: beans, rice, corn, sorghum, beverages such as juices, sodas and a cabinet to display the products.

loans.use: invest in: beans, rice, corn, sorghum, drinks such as juices, sodas and a cabinet to display the products.

loans.name: Ana Morelia

texts.es: Ana tiene 60 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia y humilde.  Ella anteriormente brindaba sus servicios como domestica pero gracias a sus ahorros actualmente ha instalado una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su hogar lo cual le permite solventar sus necesidades personales. Ana desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda ya que la parte trasera de su vivienda está cerca de un talud de tierra, por lo que ella teme que las lluvias puedan causar un deslave, por lo que Ana solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda y de esta manera proteger su vivienda y sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en: Ana is 60. She lives very happily in her own humble home. Previously, she worked as a maid, but thanks to her savings she has now opened a corner store in her home, which allows her to cover her personal needs. Ana wants to build a containing wall in her home because the back part of the home is built on a slope of land, and she is afraid that the rains will cause it to fall away. For this reason, Ana is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a containing wall in her home and thus better protect her home and her few belongings.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a containment wall in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for her store to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda lives in Dulag, Leyte. She engages in buying and selling hogs. She is a 57-year-old, married woman with three grown children. She has been engaged in selling hogs for more than 10 years now. She encountered financial problems, and is in need to continue her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy pigs and feed. These will help Imelda purchase more pigs and augment her income. Thus, her finances will become stable and she can start to do some possible business venture to have an additional source of income.

Imelda hopes that she could successfully manage her current business for the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 60 years old and married. She has nine children. To earn a living, she has a banana farm that helps her husband to support their family needs. Recently, she decided again to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the banana farm to have a good harvest so that she can bring more bananas to the market.

Rosa's plan for the future is to buy her own land to expand her vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 54 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

Esperanza is borrowing 27000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pay for the cultivation of her farm. She has been farming sugarcane for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the cultivation of her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Liz Mae

texts.en:
Liz Mae works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines.

Liz Mae requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of charcoal and gasoline to resell.

Liz Mae has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from selling gasoline.

In the future, Liz Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of charcoal and gasoline to resell.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Oliva dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a printing shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Alicia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy supplies needed like bond paper, etc. for her printing shop business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed like bond paper, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 45 years old and married with three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Jeraldine

texts.en:
Jeraldine is 28 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Jeraldine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeraldine requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years.

In the future, Jeraldine would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 45 years old and a single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leah has a general store business in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, sugar, snack foods and other personal care products.

Leah has been in this business for three years. In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, sugar, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 27 years old now.

Lorena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Lorena has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell coconut wine business.

Lorena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 31 years old and married.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, liquor, junk food and other groceries.

Lorna has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, liquor, junk food and other groceries.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lolita is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 33 years old and married with three children.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Lourdes has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lourdes aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Carmen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Carmen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell spare parts business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from bicycle transport.  Ma. Carmen is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more spare parts to sell for her buy and sell spare parts business.

Ma. Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Melanie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy vitamins etc. for her buy and sell personal product care business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is 34 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ronalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Ronalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marcos Rodolfo

texts.es:
Normalmente las personas conocen como héroes a los personajes de las películas o comics, sin embargo, en la vida real existen distintos héroes disfrazados con otras profesiones. Por ejemplo, Marcos está aprendiendo para enfrentar los conflictos de la sociedad mediante las leyes y así defender a las personas de las injusticias. Este hombre de treinta años de edad está casado y tiene un bebé de diez meses de edad que se ha vuelto en su principal inspiración.  
Ahora que el mundo está más globalizado y se ha convertido más competitivo, por esto es que Marcos quiere seguir aprendiendo para convertirse en uno de los mejores abogados del país. Por esta razón es que solicita un préstamo para pagar un curso de inglés y todos los materiales didácticos de este mismo. Con esto podrá convertirse en un profesional más completo y con grandes conocimientos. En sus planes está realizar un postgrado y luego una maestría, luego de obtener su licencia en Derecho.
texts.en:
Normally people know heroes to be like the characters of movies or comics, however, in the real world heroes exist, disguised as other professionals.  For example, Marcos is learning to confront societal conflicts through laws and in this way defend people from injustice.  

This 30 year old man is married and has a 10 month old baby, who has become his main inspiration.  Currently the world is more globalized and has become more competitive, and for this reason Marcos wants to continue learning to become on of the best lawyers of the country.   This is why he is requesting a loan to pay for an English course and all of the educational materials.  This way, he can become a more complete professional with great knowledge.  He plans to get his postgraduate degree and then a master's, and then obtain his license in laws.

loans.use: to pay for an English course and all of the educational materials.

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Nourn is 26 years old and married with a small child. He lives with his parents and his wife, who is 30 years old, in a community in the Kandal province in Cambodia. Nourn and his wife earn their main income from the business of selling firewood and they have operated the business since 2011, earning a daily income of $10. 

Nourn is taking out a loan because he needs to buy soil to fill around his house to avoid flooding in the rainy season.  He also wants to buy floor tiles to renovate his house. With the loan, he and his family will be able to live in better conditions. For more future plans, Nourn is going to expand his business and support his child in earning a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy soil to fill around his house to avoid flooding in the rainy season and also to buy floor tiles to renovate his house

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica hails from the town of Dulag, Leyte.  She is a 24-year old married woman, with a 2-year-old son. She engages in a hog raising business. She has been raising and selling hogs for three years and they are her main source of income. Aside from that, she also sells assorted accessories to have additional income.

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feeds and purchase assorted accessories. These tools are very essential in the way she raises hogs.  She could also be able to purchase more stocks of assorted accessories to be sold to her respective buyers. She could now prepare healthy diets for her child and provide other basic needs. 

Angelica is determined to expand both her businesses for the improvement of the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and purchase assorted accessories

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe, 34, is married with three young dependents. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells goods such as sugar, bread, noodles, cooking oil, soap, condiments and other supplies. She has been running her store for more than ten years. She is asking for a loan to buy more inventory for her store such as canned goods, beverages, soft drinks and toiletries. The added inventory would help boost Ma. Fe's earnings and augment her income. Ma. Fe will be very grateful for the loan, and she hopes she will be able to do some expansion and be able to manage her business for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 25 years old with four children. With one child in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for the family.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

Marilou has been in this business for 1 year now. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 61 years old and married with three children.

Adoracion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Adoracion has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Adoracion aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 57 years old, married, with four children.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Imelda has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna is a cheerful girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996. She is living in Shahristan, a mountainous district. She is single and lives with her parents. 

She has had many years of practice sewing traditional women dresses. She has a dream to open a business of sewing clothes. She hopes someday to be helpful and serve her neighbors. 

She participated at a start-up training provided by IMON for its clients. She was satisfied from the knowledge she gained and wanted to buy a sewing machine to start her business. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a sewing machine. She is planning to do business and help her parents financially. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Loteria

texts.en:
Loteria is a married woman from the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is 57 with three grown children. 

She raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing her hog raising business for five years now. In addition to hog raising, she also sells rtw (ready-to wear) like pants, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, jeans, and many others.

Loteria has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy pig feed as well as stock for rtw (ready-to-wear). It will enable Loteria to raise quality hogs that can be sold in a few months' time. It will also improve the stocks of her rtw business. Thus, her income will be higher and she could now handle her finances.

She is doing her best to continue to manage both her sources of income properly for sustainable living in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy pig feed as well as stock for rtw (ready-to-wear)

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a cheerful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She lives in the Shahristan mountainous district. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Farida is a housekeeper and does activity in agriculture. She has many years of experience in agriculture. She was informed through the mass media about IMON’s service to startup clients and decided to participate on trainings. She became one of the participants of Startup training and gained knowledge of how to start a business and become a successful entrepreneur.

Now, she is planning to buy livestock and start a new business. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness. This business will allow her to help her husband to feed their family.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Laurena

texts.en:
Laurena is 55 years old and is a widow. She lives in Pagadian, Zamboanga del Norte.

For the past 15 years, Laurena has been a farmer. She earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month and has been a member of PMPC since 2007.

Laurena is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
Melinde is 66 years old and is happily married. She lives in Pagadian, Zamboanga del Sur.

She has been a farmer for 10 years. She loves cultivating the soil to have healthy and fruitful crops to harvest.

Melinde has been a PMPC member since the year 2011. She is requesting an amount of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers for her farming land. With this assistance given, Melinde receives great help.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina grows fruits and vegetables in Tangub. This is her primary source of income for her family.

Marina makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield so that she will have good income. Recently, she needed an amount to pay for irrigation costs to soften tillage pans (compacted layers), which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC.

Marina wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply fruits and vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor on irrigation to soften tillage pans.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 53 years old and married with two children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like shampoo, canned goods and other personal care products.

Yolanda has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Yolanda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like shampoo, canned goods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 35 years old and married with five children. 

Melita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Melita has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from poultry.

Melita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 45 years old and married with two children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Jennifer has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from food vending.

Jennifer aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: As a widowed parent of six children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through seven loans from Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation NWTF. Vilma is borrowing 5000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and maintenance for her bicycle transport business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintenance for her bicycle cab.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: Zuhro was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is married with three children, and she lives in a small village near hills and mountains. She is a hardworking woman with many years experience in agriculture. Zuhro takes care of livestock and knows how to look after crops. She is a strong, responsible, and honest person. She participated in a three-day training session provided by Kiva's partner, IMON International, for business startups. She gained knowledge from the training and wishes to start a business for keeping livestock. She is asking for a loan from KIVA lenders to buy livestock. This loan will help her to start a business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is a hardworking man. He was born in southern Tajikistan in 1993. He is married and living in a rural area with his family. He is a responsible, honest and capable person. 

The condition in the rural area is not good for doing business. But Jamshed is strong and tries to do his best to work and earn money to feed his family. He has experience of serving people as a rental worker. Additionally he has a garden where he can plant agriculture. 

Now, he is planning to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant in his garden to harvest later, to have additional income to feed his family. He is asking financial support from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and seeds. He hopes his efforts for his family will succeed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia  Judith se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de prestar servicio de movilidad, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Judith continues dedicating herself to her business selling clothing and mobile services.  Through this business, the member wants to move her family forward.  She is an enterprising and hard-working woman.   

The member is happy to have the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy polos, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa stocks up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative.

Marissa hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: El Regreso Group

texts.es:
El mes de abril es de gran relevancia para los habitantes de Veracruz pues se lleva a cabo su famoso Carnaval. Muchas de las comunidades se dan cita para presenciar la tradicional coronación de los reyes de dicha celebración.
   En una de estas comunidades se integró el grupo El Regreso formado por ocho mujeres comprometidas con el bienestar de su familia para lo cual trabajan arduamente, ellas son: Juana quien vende zapatos, artículos de papelería, ropa y bolsas; María y Luisa, ropa; Laura y Amelia, comida; Leidy, zapatos, bolsos y carteras; Rocío, abarrotes y tortillas mientras que Ana vende calzado.
   Rocío, o Chío como le llaman de cariño, es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos dependen de ella y de su esposo Alfonso con quien logró abrir una tortillería desde hace doce años. La idea de crear su propio negocio surgió pues su esposo laboró durante seis años en una tortillería de la comunidad, allí aprendió toda lo necesario para manejar la propia, así que decidieron emprender su negocio. “Lo logramos con esfuerzo, ahorros y trabajando en equipo”.
   Rocío ofrece el producto directamente en su negocio pero también cuenta con dos repartidores que llevan las tortillas a domicilio para lo cual ella debe preparar, pesar, y armar los paquetes. Rocío está muy entusiasmada ya que con sus ganancias pudo abrir una tienda de abarrotes además de seguir dando mantenimiento a su tortillería y poder adquirir muebles para su hogar.
   Con la oportunidad del préstamo, Chío invertirá en sacos de harina para continuar con el negocio, también planea ampliar su tortillería adquiriendo otra máquina con lo que también beneficiará a la comunidad pues dará trabajo a dos repartidores más.
   El Regreso agradece la confianza obtenida para poder adquirir el préstamo ya que representa un apoyo en su crecimiento.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de abarrotes, Chío es quien sostiene una tortilla.
texts.en:
The month of April is of great significance to the residents of Veracruz because of the famous Carnaval.  Many of the communities plan a date to witness the traditional coronation of the kings of the celebration. 

 In one of these communities, the group El Regreso was formed by 8 women dedicated to the well-being of their families, for which they work arduously.   These woman are:  Juana who sells shoes, paper products, clothing and purses, Maria and Luisa who sell clothing, Laura and Amelia who sell food, Leidy who sells shoes, bags and wallets, Rocio who sells groceries and tortillas and Ana who sells footwear.  

Rocio, or Chío as she is nicknamed, is a mother to three children, two of which depend on her and her husband Alfonso, who was able to open a tortilla business two years ago.  The idea to start their own business came about, as her husband worked for 6 years at another tortilla business in the community.  There, he learned everything necessary to manage his own, and decided to begin his business.  "We accomplished it with effort, savings, and working as a team" they say.  

Rocío offers their products directly in her business, but also has two delivery-people who takes the tortillas to homes.  In this case, she prepares, weighs, and packages the tortillas.  Rocío is very enthusiastic about the earning, as she was able to open a grocery store while continuing to maintain the tortilla business and buy furniture for her home. 

With the opportunity for this loan,  Chío will invest in bags of flour to continue her business.  She also plans to expand her tortilla business and acquire another machine, which will benefit the community as it would create jobs for two more deliver-people.   

El Regreso is thankful for the confidence obtained from being able to acquire a loan and support growth.  

*The photograph was taken in the grocery store.  Chío is the one holding up a tortilla.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 60 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, and canned goods. 

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is 35 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one son and one daughter, and her husband has a scrap recycling business,.

Kiran's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it but due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy scrap in bulk. Therefore Kiran has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase scrap material in bulk so that he can easily continue with the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income from his business.

Kiran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy scrap in bulk for her husband's scrap recycling business.

loans.name: Sreynet's Group

texts.en: Sreynet’s group live in a rural village in Pursat province in Cambodia. Sreynet makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yan makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time that has been spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a modest woman. She is aged 33 and the perfect mother of 2 children. She lives with her family in the city of Qurgan-tube. She has worked in agriculture for over 10 years. She works hard, because this kind of activity is the main source of income for her and her family. 

Now their life conditions are bad and their house is very old. Jamila decided to renovate the house but she does not have enough money. For this reason, she applied for a loan hoping that Kiva lenders will not refuse to help her. She believes in you. Please help Jamila to improve her life. Thank you!

loans.use: To renovate her home

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1985. She is living in the city of Vahdat with her family. The city is attractive for tourists due to its geographical location. Vahdat is famous for its wonderful healing springs, wilderness forests, and rapid mountain rivers. Vahdat and its surroundings are of interest primarily for hikers on mountain massifs. 

Aziza is married and has four children. She has four years of practice doing business in the market, selling and buying clothing. She sells good quality goods and has permanent clients. This coming season she wants to buy a collection of clothing. She asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy clothing to sell and earn money. She hopes she will earn a better profit next season and be able to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy a collection of clothing to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar jora para preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Martha continues to work selling chica.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who, through this small business, has helped move her family forward.   She requests this loan to buy corn to prepare chicha (a traditional corn-based drink).  The member is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn to make chicha.

loans.name: Savrigul

texts.en: Savrigul is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She lives in a small town with her family. She is married and has two children. She has ten years practice of sewing national dresses for women. She has permanent clients and likes her business. She takes orders at home and tries to sew up-to-date clothing. Recently, her business has been doing well, but she needs a car to drive to the centre of the city to sell her dresses. Unfortunately, her saved up money is not enough to buy a car. She requested a loan from KIVA lenders to buy a car. She awaits your kindness and hopes to have a profitable business.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is a resident in the town of Tanauan, Leyte. She is a 28 year old married woman with four children ages 7-1 year old. She earns a livelihood by means of a dried fish vending business. She buys and, at the same time, sells dried fish to the locals in her place

She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of dried fish. This way, Lyra would be able to purchase more stock and be able to sell to her buyers. This will allow her to improve her sales and settle her obligations. With these, she would be able to provide for the needs of her family and also continue to send them to school.

Lyra hopes that she could properly handle her livelihood for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of dried fish

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is married, 33 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Rachel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rachel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren’s group lives in a rural village in Pursat province in Cambodia. Ren makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.  In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and also save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sopheary's Group

texts.en:
Sopheary’s group live in a rural village in Pursat province in Cambodia. Sopheary makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Davlatmoi

texts.en:
Davlatmoi is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1991. She is single and lives in a remote district with her parents. She is a strong, patient and honest person. She always supports and helps her parents at keeping the household and doing home activities. 

She has four years experience in agriculture. She plants vegetables, cereals and other agricultural products. Each season she harvests and sells it in the domestic market. She likes to do business, so she is preparing the land for the next season. 

She asks for a loan to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to process her land. Then she will plant agricultural products. She hopes to have a good  harvest and benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to process her land, and then plant agricultural products

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en: Mariafe makes a living through her retail business. She runs a sari-sari store business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she has availed of a loan to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. Mariafe hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.en: Gulruhsor is a strong woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is divorced and has two children. She has had difficulties in raising her children after the divorce. In order to overcome these difficulties she started a business. She is selling and buying women's and children's clothing in the domestic market. She serves clients politely and has permanent clients every day. A new season is coming and she wants to buy a collection of women's and children's clothing. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a collection of clothing to sell. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a collection of women's and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Hadisa

texts.en: Hadisa is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is living in a remote district with her parents. She is divorced and has one child. They live in bad conditions, and the standard of living does not permit them to live better. It is hard to raise and look after her child alone. She does business in order to feed her family. She is trading in a grocery store. Hadisa is polite, honest, and a communicative person. She attracts permanent clients to her store. She appealed to IMON asking for a loan to renovate her apartment. She hopes it will help her family live better. She will try to gain more profit from her business for her family's needs and expenditure.

loans.use: to renovate her apartment.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is 54 years old and married with one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonides requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Leonides has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonides would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom’s group live in a rural village in Pursat province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.en:
Zulaiho is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has four children. 

Zulaiho has 25 years of experience doing business. She knows her activity well and likes to do business, being helpful and serving people. She was taught by her mother and was always interested in sewing traditional women's dresses. 

She is planning to buy textiles and sew dresses to sell in the domestic market. She wants to enlarge her business. She appealed to CSC MDO IMON International and asked for a loan to buy textiles to sew traditional women's dresses. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy textiles to sew traditional women's dresses.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 26 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Jean has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Daryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Daryl works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell vegetables. Daryl is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell in her stall for her fish-vending business.

Daryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Erlinda has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fruit to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.en:
Bunafsha is a sociable and hardworking 37 year old woman. She lives with her 3 children and husband in the city of Dushanbe. Her husband is a taxi driver and the children are minors. 

Bunafsha has a secondary school education, so she earns a living with her sewing activity. She has been sewing for over 3 years in her own home. She is a very good dressmaker and has many clients. 

Bunafsha wants to expand her business, and for this she needs to buy a new sewing machine. Her own capital is not enough and for this reason she applied for a loan. From the profit of her activity, she would like to buy furniture for her home. Bunafsha hopes for Kiva lenders support and understanding.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman. She is 36 years old and has three children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur

Aileen has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more ready to wear clothes such as t-shirts, pants, shorts, shoes, etc.

Aileen has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear clothing, such as t-shirts, pants, shorts, shoes, etc

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Magdalina works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Magdalina is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Magdalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she may continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business, like bananas, sugar, and cooking oil.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business, like bananas, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Josephine has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like clothes.

Josephine has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cultivate 2 acres of land with maize

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; La socia es la Sra. Gladys; la socia continua dedicándose al  negocio de venta de cuyes y pollos, la socia continua criando  a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez trabaja en una empresa privada, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos y cuyes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa” comunal bank. Her name is Gladys. She has a small business selling guinea pigs and chickens. She raises these small animals and later sells them to the customers that request them. 

She also works for a private business, which helps her provide for her family. 

She asks for this loan to buy food and guinea pigs.

The borrower is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy food and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr:
Agée de 46 ans, Delphine est mariée (25 ans de mariage). Son mari travail, et il est chauffeur de taxi-bus.Il ont cinq enfants dont deux vont encore à l'école (18 et 16 ans) et les autres sont déjà mariés et ont leur propre foyer et n'habitent plus avec elle.
Delphine dirige un magasin général et cela depuis l'année 2005. En général, la vente est en détail et en demi-gros. Elle demande du crédit afin de pouvoir mieux ravitailler et diversifier ses stocks de marchandises. En plus, elle veut devenir une grande grossiste.
Le parcours de l'étude de ses deux enfants sont encore loin, son objectif est de les faire réussir dans leurs études, qu'ils puissent continuer jusqu' aux études supérieures à l'université.
texts.en:
Delphine is 46 years old and has been married for 25 years. Her husband works as bus driver. They have five children, two of whom are still in school (16 and 18 years old). The others are already married and have their own households, so they no longer live with her.

Delphine has been running a general store since 2005. She sells for retail and retail-wholesale prices. She is asking for a loan to replenish and diversify her inventory. She also wants to become a large wholesaler. 

Her children still have a number of years of schooling, so her goal is to help them succeed in their studies, so that they can stay in school through university.

loans.use: buy products such as perfumes, thread for sewing, flashlights, and different types of batteries.

loans.name: Syrgabu

texts.ru: Сыргабу, 52 года, замужем, 6 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 9 коров, а также 1,40 Га арендованной и 0,60 Га собственной поливной земли, где она выращивает арбузы, кукурузу и клевер. Сыргабу известна, как спокойный, честный, любезный и трудолюбивый человек. На сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме от 15,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сыргабу обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Syrgabu is 52 years old, married and has six children. She has finished a technical college. As a main source of income for her family she does farming. She has nine cows as well as 1.4 ha [3.5 acres] of leased and 0.6 ha [1.5 acres] of own land, where she grows watermelons, corn and clover. Syrgabu is knows as a calm, honest, friendly and hard-working person. At present she receives a monthly income in the amount of 15,000 KGS. In order to develop his farm further, Syrgabu has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 120,000, which she will use to buy cows. She plans to use the revenues from her loan to develop her farm and finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie works hard to support her family. Analie is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Analie requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and sea foods to sell.

Analie has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and sea foods to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are still in school.

Arlene is in the agriculture business, raising a pig in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Arlene has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA,el banco está ubicado en LA provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Dionicia tiene 49 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de chicha y cerveza, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank SANTA ROSITA DE ALLUPAMPA.  The bank is located in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  

 The member Dionicia is 49 years old and has 3 children and a partner.  The member alternates her daily activities, selling chicha and beer.
