She has a god amount of experience in her business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day.   The member wishes to continue working to continue supporting her family.  

The member requests a loan to buy corn and others.  She feels thankful for the credit and promises to comply with the established payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn, and others.

loans.name: Jovito Jr.

texts.en:
Jovito Jr. is 55 years old, married and has three children. He is engaged in the rice production business, as a source of living for his family. He took a loan again to buy fertilizer for the farm, so that it will result in a good harvest and generate more income from his rice production.

Jovito Jr. plans to expand his business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production to gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production, increasing the number of litres of milk supplied to her customers to meet their demands and the needs of her family.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 51 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, Marieta works very hard to provide for them.

Marieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marieta has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other personal care products. 

In the future Marieta would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Cristina is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to  purchase more fish to sell to her customers at her fish vending business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de prestar servicio de movilidad, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de estos negocios la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Margarita continues working in her business selling clothes and mobile services.  She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who has been able to move her family forward through these businesses.   The member is requesting a loan to buy polos, sweaters, and blouses.  She is happy to have a loan and promises to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to buy polos, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás es un agricultor muy emprendedor de 65 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra casado y ha procreado 10 hijos de los cuales ya solo dos viven con él, lamentablemente, la situación económica en la que vivía su familia no le permitió prepararse académicamente. 
Como antes se mencionaba, Tomás es agricultor, esta actividad la ha desempeñado desde que tenía 10 años, pero además, a medida pasó el tiempo aprendió otros oficios y es por ello que también trabaja con un carro transportando personas o materiales de trabajo. 

El crédito que él está solicitando, lo necesita muchísimo para comprar repuestos a su carro y hacerle ajustes, ya que es la herramienta indispensable para realizar su trabajo.
Como toda persona perseverante, él piensa en seguir trabajando aunque ya se sienta cansado por los años, pero considera que aún puede hacer muchas cosas buenas por su familia.
texts.en:
Tomás is an enterprising farmer of 65 years of age.  He is married and fathered 10 children, 2 of which live with him.  Unfortunately, the economic situation of his family did not allow him to academically prepare himself.  

As previously mentioned, Tomas is a farmer, an activity he has carried out for 10 years.  However, as time passed he learned other trades, and because of this he also works with a car transporting people or materials to work.  The loan he is requesting is very much needed to buy spare parts for his car and make adjustments, as it is an indispensable part of his work.  As with all persistent people, he plans to continue working, though he now feels tired for all the years, he still thinks he can do many good things for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car and make adjustments, as it is an indispensable tool to do his job.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ground for bricks making to gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Oydona

texts.en:
Oydona is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1953 and lives in a remote district with her family. She is divorced and has three children. She is a strong, responsible and kind person. She alone raised her children through the hard times in her life.

Oydona started an agricultural business 10 years ago, in order to feed her family. She is an experienced farmer and plants vegetables and cereal on her land and sells her harvests in the domestic market. She also keeps livestock for additional income.

Years have gone by, and now she does not have enough strength to be active in agriculture and keep livestock. Her son is now grown and to help his mother financially, he decided to fly to Russia and earn money. Oydona wants to support her son and appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to buy a ticket for her son. She hopes her son will find a good job and send her money to feed their family.

She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy an airline ticket for her son

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is single and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Janet has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns income from fish vending.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia Teresa se dedica al negocio de fotocopiadora,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de fotocopiadora.La socia solicita el credito para comprar papales para la fotocopiadora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa has a photocopying business through which she wants to support her family. 

She hopes to expand the photocopying business and is applying for a loan in order to buy paper for the photocopier. 

Teresa is happy about the loan and promises to make all her repayments.

loans.use: to buy paper for the photocopier.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia Maria Luisa se sigue dedicando al negocio confecciones como pantalones, faldas, vestidos, pantalones y blusas, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telas, tijeras e hilos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is still working in the making of clothing, such as pants, skirts, dresses, and shirts. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who wishes to help her family get ahead with this business. She asks for the loan to purchase fabric, scissors, and thread. 
She is happy for the loan and is committed to meeting the payments.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, scissors, and thread.

loans.name: El Maguey Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca hay un barrio muy tranquilo en dónde aún se puede respirar aire fresco y limpio, el poblado también ofrece amaneceres inigualables a la vista. En dicha localidad se integró el grupo El Maguey conformado por ocho mujeres emprendedoras, ellas son: Yolanda quien vende comida, refrescos y dulces; Aracely y Aidee ofrecen ropa por catálogo; Primitiva vende pan; Angelina, pan y dulces;  Francisca vende calzado por catálogo; Vanessa tiene una tienda de abarrotes y María vende masa. 
   Vanessa es una joven muy trabajadora y comprometida con sus metas es por eso que desde hace cinco años ha mantenido el establecimiento de abarrotes que abrió junto con su mamá. Al inicio era muy poca la mercancía que ofrecía, no tenía ni siquiera un lugar en donde acomodarla. Tiempo después el negocio creció y con las ganancias pudo comprar anaqueles en donde exhibe sus productos principalmente arroz, frijol, sopa y productos enlatados. Con las ganancias también ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares.
   Asimismo Vanessa siente un profunda pasión por la docencia hecho que la llevo a estudiar pedagogía en una escuela privada, desafortunadamente tuvo que interrumpir dichos estudios debido a un problema de salud familiar sin embargo su determinación ha hecho que hoy en día pueda brindar servicio a la comunidad y de esta manera será becada para continuar con sus estudios. Vanessa está contenta pues la tienda de abarrotes brinda frutos y además continúa su desarrollo académico.
   En esta ocasión el préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para comprar aceite, arroz, frijol, azúcar, maíz, queso, papel higiénico, detergente y refrescos, debido a que es la mercancía que más solicitan sus clientes.
   El grupo entero muestra sus gratitud con estas palabras: “Gracias por confiar en nosotros, con cada uno de los préstamos han apoyado al alcance de nuestras metas”.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa del hijo de doña Angelina, Vanessa es quien viste blusa café y short estampado.
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a very quiet neighborhood where you can still smell fresh clean air. The community also has unequaled sunrises to enjoy. In this place the "El Maguey" group got together, made up of 8 enterprising women. They are: Yolanda who sells meals, soft drinks and sweets; Aracely y Aidee offer clothing by catalog; Primitiva sells bread; Angelina sells bread and sweets; Francisca sells footwear by catalog; Vanessa has a grocery store and María sells dough (for tortillas).

Vanessa is a hard-working youth committed to her goals. For this reason she has kept her grocery store that she opened with her mother, running for the past 5 years. At the beginning there was little merchandise on offer, she didn't even have a place to put them. After time the business grew and with the profits she was able to buy shelves to exhibit her products, mainly rice, beans, soup and canned goods. With the profits she also helped her parents with the household expenses.

At the same time Vanessa felt a deep passion for teaching which led her to study education in a private school. Unfortunately she had to discontinue these studies due to a family health problem. However her determination has allowed her to serve her community and doing this she got a scholarship to continue her studies.

Vanessa is content as the grocery store is bearing fruit and she is continuing her academic development. At this time she will use the loan she is requesting to buy oil, rice, beans, sugar, corn, cheese, toilet paper, detergent and soft drinks as this is the merchandise most requested by her clients.

The entire group expresses their gratitude with these words, " Thanks for having confidence in us. With each one of the loans we have been able to achieve our goals". The photograph was taken at the house of the son of Angelina. Vanessa is wearing a brown blouse and printed shorts.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, sugar, corn, cheese, toilet paper, detergent and soft drinks.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a mother of five children, but three are married already. To earn income, she runs a rice production business so that she can help her husband in providing their children's daily needs. 

She needs financial assistance for her rice farm. Recently, she decided to again request a loan to buy fertilizer for the rice farm to have good production and a good harvest.

For the future, Amalia wants to save money from her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the rice farm.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Haide is 29 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Haide has a retail ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Haide requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like socks, shirts, and other clothing.

Haide has been in this business for two years. In the future, Haide would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like socks, shirts, and other clothing.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 48 years old, has two children and is in the livestock business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to use when raising her livestock. Juanita has been in this business for eight years and has taken out and repaid eight prior loans from NWTF. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future to her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna works hard to support her family. Johna is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Johna requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like fish nets, bamboo, and gasoline and to pay for maintenance for her boat.

Johna has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like fish nets, bamboo, and gasoline and to pay for maintenance on her boat

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: As the married parent of four children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family by selling rice in the Philippines. She supplements her income by selling charcoal. Mary Jean has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to  buy more rice to sell to her customers. She has sustained her business with help from five prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Lolita Thelma

texts.en:
Lolita Thelma is a 58-year-old married woman with six children, one of whom is in school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and does business buying and selling copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more copra to sell.

Lolita Thelma has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy more copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children, two of whom are still in school. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to use when raising her pig. She has been in this business for four years now and has taken out and repaid two prior loans from NWTF to sustain her work. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella sells dried fish. She is 31 years old,  married, has two children and resides in the town of Tanauan, Leyte. She buys and sells fish in the local area. She is in need of capital to continue her business.

She is asking for a loan to buy fish and equipment like drying racks and a wooden box. These will help improve Estrella's business by increasing daily sales and meeting her customers' needs. With an increase in profit, she could provide her children with nutritious diets.

Estrella hopes to send her children to school for a brighter future. She is eager to properly manage her business for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy fish and equipment like drying racks and a wooden box

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en: Nazokat is 42 years old, has two children and lives with her family in the city of Qurgan-Tube. Currently, her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Nazokat has been involved in agriculture for 15 years. She tries to provide her children with good living conditions. Her children help her work. Nazokat wants to renovate her home and applied for a loan. She does not have enough money, but believes that with the help of Kiva lenders she can solve her problems.

loans.use: To renovate her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 38-year-old married woman with four children, who are all presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a pig-raising business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Julita has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Lenor

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lenor works hard to support her family. She does business selling dried fish in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

Lenor is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is 47 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and personal care products.

Janita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and personal care products.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a 39-year-old widow with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Lorena has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lorena would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 44 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Melanie works very hard to provide for him.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell, like soft-drinks, bread, canned goods, spices, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell, like soft-drinks, bread, canned goods, spices, etc

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 38 years old, married and has six children, three in school.

Bella is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Bella requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Bella has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Bella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 56 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like bread, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Celestina has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Celestina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like bread, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition fees in nursing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Grp Msm Peace Group

texts.en:
Donard is a single man in his late 20s with one daughter who attends school.  He has sold  second hand clothes for three years and works from 7am to 6pm daily.  He is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Donard's 2nd loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase his stock by buying a bale of better quality second hand clothes.  This enabled him to sell to many customers.  He appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to pay school fees, loan payments, and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more bales and up-to-date second hand clothes to meet his customers' demand and requirements.  He dreams of building his own house.

Donard will share this loan with his loan group Grp Msm Peace which consist of five members who  hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more bales and up-to-date second hand clothes to  meet his customers' demand and requirements.

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri is a 27-years-old single young man from the city of Khan Younis. He lives with his mother in a simple house. His mother is an employee in the public sector and earns s a low income which barely covers all the family's needs. 

Sabri is a student in a local university  studying business administration. Je wants to complete his studies and find a job to support his family. 

Sabri took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. this will help him to do his home work and write reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Savrigul

texts.en:
Savrigul is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She lives in village with her family and is married, with one child. Her husband is an emigrant. Savrigul is a nurse in a domestic medical centre. 

They live in a bad condition; their house is old and needs to be renovated. Savrigul’s salary is not enough to save money for renovation. It is enough only for everyday needs, like clothing and food for her family. She appealed to IMON and asked for financial support. She wants to buy construction supplies. She wishes to have better conditions for living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca hay una región en donde el campo es la principal actividad laboral, la caña es el producto agrícola más importante pero una vez que termina la época de zafra, o recolección, los habitantes comienzan a sembrar otros productos para que la tierra continúe fructífera.

   El grupo Alfa y Omega se formó en dicha región, el nombre fue designado ya que de manera simbólica alude al principio y al final, es decir, a la totalidad de las cosas. Los integrantes y sus actividades son: Juana quien maneja una tienda de abarrotes; Rosalba quien vende ropa; Lorena y Guadalupe, calzado; Irma, tacos, volovanes y pizzas; Verónica, artículos de plata; Julia, joyería de plata, cerámica, bolsas y colchas; Blanca, antojitos y Virginia, carne. 

   Irma es una mujer trabajadora y con una fortaleza inigualable, misma que le ayudó a enfrentar el fallecimiento de un hijo hace cuatro años. El tratamiento médico una gran inversión económica razón por la cual comenzó a vender comida justo fuera de su hogar. Su esposo, el señor Miguel, ha estado siempre a su lado y juntos llevan el negocio; él vende pizzas y volovanes fuera de casa mientras ella atiende el negocio de tacos. 
   Doña Irma ha invertido anteriormente en utensilios e ingredientes para cocinar, lo que ha ayudado a que el negocio se vaya consolidando gradualmente. 
 En esta ocasión, Irma necesita un préstamo para comprar, varilla, cemento, anaqueles y  pintura ya que pretende remodelar el espacio donde prepara los tacos, también invertirá en gas, aceite, tortillas, harina y carne para continuar con su actividad y la de su esposo. 

   El grupo Alfa y Omega agradece la posibilidad del préstamo pues esto los ayuda a cambiar sus vidas de manera positiva. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el local donde Doña Irma prepara los tacos, viste blusa verde con blanco y cuello negro.
texts.en:
There is a region in Oaxaca, Mexico, where the fields are the main source of work. Sugar cane is the most common farming product here but after the harvest the locals also begin to sow other products so that the land continues to provide a yield.

The “Alfa y Omega” group is from this region and was given this name to refer symbolically to the beginning and the end, to the totality of things. The members of the group have different trades: Juana has a grocery shop; Rosalba sells clothing; Lorena and Guadalupe sell footwear; Iram sells tacos, vol-au-vents and pizzas; Verónica sells silver products; Julia sells silver jewellery, ceramics, bags and bedspreads; finally, Blanca sells snacks and Viriginia sells meat.

Irma is a hard-working woman with unbeatable strength. This strength helped her to face the death of one of her sons four years ago. The cost of medical treatment was high and so she started to sell food just outside of her house. Irma’s husband, Miguel, has always been by Irma’s side and together the couple work at the business. Miguel sells pizzas and vol-au-vents, while Irma tends to the taco business.

Irma has previously invested in utensils and cooking ingredients, helping her to consolidate her business gradually.

On this occasion, Irma is applying for a loan in order to buy gas, oil, tortillas, flour, and meat to continue with her and her husband’s business, and metal bars, cement, paint and shelves to remodel the area where she the couple sells tacos.

*The photograph was taken at the place where Irma grows tacos. Irma is wearing a green and white blouse with a black collar.

loans.use: to buy gas, oil, tortillas, flour, meat, metal bars, cement, paint and shelves.

loans.name: Jairus

texts.en:
Jairus is 53 years old and married with two children. He has been running a butcher shop for the last 20 years, and it has been profitable.

He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya, with which he plans to buy a cow for slaughter, and he hopes this will enable him to have more stock of meat to sell to his customers.

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hope is to expand his business by opening another butcher shop in the area.

loans.use: to buy a cow for slaughter, so as to have more stock of meat to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Merlinda requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients, utensils and materials for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, utensils and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a 59 -year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Cristita has had a restaurant business for ten years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

In the future, Cristita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jocery

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jocery works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Jocery is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Jocery has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonieta is 42 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Antonieta has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Antonieta has been in this business for two years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 38 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Melisa has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Melisa requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

Melisa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Melisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 61 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, and other groceries.

Emerita has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 57 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 3° grado, es viudo y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 3 viven con él, pues los mayores ya se casaron.

Pedro es agricultor desde muy pequeño, durante toda su vida ha realizado cultivo de maíz y hortalizas, dicho trabajo lo aprendió de su padre y es lo que le ha servido para salir adelante con su familia.

Este crédito le servirá a Pedro para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda y para comprar insumos para cultivar sandía.

Como toda persona visionaria, él tiene muchas metas y para ello espera seguir trabajando en sus tierras ya que de eso mantiene a sus hijos, y además planea adquirir otro crédito más adelante para seguir con sus trabajos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 57 years old and only has a third-grade education. He is a widower and has five children, just three of whom live at home; the eldest children are married.

Pedro has been a farmer since a young age. He has spent his whole life growing corn and vegetables, having learned the trade from his father. This work has allowed Pedro to move forward with his family.
This loan will allow Pedro to buy materials to improve his home and to buy supplies to grow watermelons.

Like all visionaries, Pedro has many goals. He hopes to continue working on his land, as this allows him to support his children. He also wants to take out another loan in the future so that he can continue working in farming.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve his home and to buy supplies to grow watermelons.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 47 years old and supports a family of 4 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 20 years earning an income of KES10,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve her farming through modern farming, for more income to improve family living standards. 

She plans to use the gained profits to pay her loan and expand her farming activity. 

Her future hope is to initiate a business.

loans.use: to improve her farming through modern farming for more income to improve her family living standards.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a 22-years-old single young man from the city of Rafah. He lives with his family in a simple house. He is an employee in the public sector and earns a low income whih barely covers the family's needs. 

Mousa is also a student in a local university, studying business administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a better job in the future. 

Mousa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to do his home work and write the reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 32 years old and supports nine family members. She has been a farmer for the last seven years, and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which she plans to purchase a cow for milk production to meet the demand of her customers and expand her agricultural activities by being a mixed farmer.

She plans to use her gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production to meet the demand of her customers and expand her agricultural activities by being a mixed farmer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds for high production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
When we fail to plan, we plan to fail. And it is never an optio for Rowelyn to fail. That is why, with a dream to send her children to school and make them finish their studies, she is working very hard to push her business to progress. 

Rowelyn is a 33-year-old resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is currently acquainted with selling biscuits in town. With her husband, Manuel, she runs the business with passion and hope. They also trade charcoal.

They would like to have more supplies to sell and requests 9,000 PHP to purchase more quantities of biscuits. She looks forward to this financial assistance and prays that more blessings will come  to all lenders who  continually supporting entrepreneurs like her.

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to acquire more quantities of biscuits for her enterprise.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 59 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eden is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eden has been raising pigs for ten years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials, like fishing nets, gasoline and maintenance for her boat.
Nena has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials, like nets, gasoline and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 42-year-old married woman with four children all attend school. Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma has run a general store for 2 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy snack food, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy snack food, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 68 years old and widowed, with seven children. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, shampoo and other personal care products.

Teresa has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Winners Women And Men Association Salama Group

texts.en:
The group pictured is comprised of enterprising men and women who are focused on developing themselves and their households to deliver themselves from poverty. Margret is a new client in UGAFODE Microfinance Limited MDI, who has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 through the group. She is a married woman with children.

She is a businesswoman rearing birds at her home in order to provide for herself and her children. She is limited by capital to enlarge her business, so in a bid to increase her working capital and expand the business, she has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy poultry feed. She will feed this to her chickens for faster growth and increased weight. She will be able to sell them at a higher price and increase her profit. However, she will still need to face challenges of competition and possibly diseases which affect the birds' growth and productivity.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for the birds

loans.name: Mohammad Ata

texts.en:
Mohammad Ata is a 48-year-old married Palestinian father of four children. He has been working in transporting students for 13 years, but because of his limited income, he got employed in a chicken-selling shop eight months ago to satisfy his family's needs.

Mohammad Ata is an ambitious man and a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop his business. Thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new bus, which will help him attract more students.

Mohammad Ata hopes to expand his business much more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new bus, which will help him attract more students

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 62-year-old married  man who supports 5 family members. He has been operating his butcher shop for  5 years and the business earns 6,000 KES per month.

Nelson has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to open a new butcher shop for more income. 

He plans to use anticipated profit to repay the loan and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to open a new butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  dried fish.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 19-year-old single young man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his mother in a simple house. His mother is an employee in the public sector, where she earns a low income that can barely cover all of the family's needs.

Ibrahim is a student in a local university, where he studies business administration. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in the future to support his family.

Ibrahim took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies, which will help him to do his assignments and write his reports easily.

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
Farrah is a 33-yeaer-old married woman with one child who attends schools. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Farrah has had a food vending business for 1 year and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  milk and coconut juice.

In the future, Farrah would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy milk and coconut juice.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 61-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Francisca has had a food vending business for 1 year and requests 4,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sugar and vinegar.

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and vinegar.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Salve is 36 years old and four of her children are in school.

Salve has a business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of used shoes to sell.

Salve has been in this business for three years. In the future, Salve would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Sria's Group

texts.en: Sria’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sria makes a living cultivating rice and raising ducks to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is a 45-year-old married Syrian father of four children. He has been  a barber for seventeen years. He is able to cover the needs and expenses of his family. 

Bayan works hard and trys desperately to improve his family's living conditions and requested a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's tuition fees.

Bayan is an ambitious man, well-known among his region for his professional skills. He hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia Margot se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Member Margot continues in the business of food sales. She is a quick-learning woman who through this business wants her children to be able to complete their studies. Her dream is to have a big restaurant. She requests a loan to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat. She is happy for the first loan and is committed to completing the payments of her quota.

loans.use: The member requests a loan to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a 36-year-old man who supports a family of 5 members. 

He has been practicing small-scale farming for 10 years and earns 7,000 KES per month. He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy hybrid seedlings and fertilizer. 

He plans to use the gained profits to repay his loan and expand his farming activity.

 His future hopes is to initiate a business.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He is from Kisumu. John operates a motorbike transportation, which he has been doing for five years. He generates a monthly income of 50,000 KES.

John requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase a new motorbike. He hopes to be able to support his family and expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business. His dream to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motobike

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 59 years old and married. To earn income and be able to provide for his family, he runs a vegetable gardening business.

He needs financial assistance to increase his income. Therefore, he decided to take a loan to purchase additional seedlings for the vegetable garden, which he hopes will result in a good harvest and enable him to have more vegetables to sell in the market.

Manuel wants, in the future, to uplift the living condition of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings for his vegetable garden.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a 42-year-old woman, who came from Payatas, Quezon City. She is married to Dominador, a field coordinator. 

She is asking for  33,000 PHP to buy additional supplies to display in her store, as she believes that the more products displayed relates to more profit. This will really be a great help for her to earn and save money for her children's education. At the same time, she can use the profit to cover daily household expenses. 

Elvie would really appreciate your generosity in advance. Someday, she wants to expand her business and help others. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy varieties of products to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marybell

texts.en:
Marybell is a 38-year-old married woman with four children, three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marybell has had a food vending business for  1 year and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Marybell would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a53-year-old  married woman with six children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nelia has had a rice vending business for 1 year and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 60 years old, married and has four children.

Editha is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Editha has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en: Khim’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Khunguni Group

texts.en:
Vaida is 42 years old, and she sells fish to people in her community. She started this business in order to earn funds to support her family and to provide them with their needed resources. Vaida has five children, and only three of her children go to school.

Vaida will use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more stock. She plans to build a better house for her children. The profits resulting from her loans have helped her to be able to pay school fees for her children and to provide them with clothing.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old and married to Joseph. She supports five family members. She has been a farmer for the last nine years, and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 11,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which she plans to purchase fertilizers and inputs for better produce when harvest comes, so as to meet the demands of her clients.

Christine plans to use her gained profit to repay the loan and expand her agricultural activities. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and inputs for better produce when harvest comes, so as to meet the demands of her clients.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old, married, and has seven children. She is a merchant from Tanauan, Leyte, selling dried fish, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. 

Teresita requested a loan, which she will use to buy fish and materials such as drying racks and wooden boxes for storage.  These are essential tools that will help Teresita boost her livelihood.  With an increased income, she will be able to handle her finances and continue to support the needs of her youngest child. In the future, Teresita hopes that her business will be productive and sustainable.

loans.use: purchase buy fish and materials for storage

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is a 50-year-old married homemaker with three children.  She lives in a village in the Kandal province of Cambodia. Her husband is a 55-year-old construction worker. 

Two of her children work in a factory and one attends school. Her husband and the two children earn $14 daily. Srey needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for the two children to commute to work and have better traveling conditions. 

In the future, Srey wants to build a bigger house and hopes to help the youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her two children to commute to work.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells a range of commodities including eggs, cooking oil, noodles, soap, soft drinks and other beverages.  She is a 48-year-old woman with seven children. Two of them are still attending school. Her husband is a fisherman.  

Wilma has requested a loan to buy assorted goods, such as soft drinks, condiments, seasonings and canned goods. Wilma will be able to display a greater variety of stock, and thus could attract more buyers to come and shop. As a result, her earnings would be augmented and she would able to provide her family with good food. Additionally, she could continue to finance the schooling of her two children. 

She is hoping that someday, she will be successful in handling her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 33 years old, married, and supports a family of four members. He has been operating as a small scale farmer for 15 years and earns 15,000 KES per month.

Evans requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya for 25,000 KES, which he will use to buy a dairy cow so as to increase the amount of milk supplied for more income gain. He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and to educate his children. He hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 34-year-old married woman with three children.  She has  a sari-sari store business to help her husband  with expenses.

She needs financial assistance to buy additional grocery items for the store to sell.  She wants to increase her store inventory and have more sales.

Arlyn's plan for the future to save money  from her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items..

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros wants to send her deepest gratitude to you for being so generous to her. Through what you have loaned, she was able to improve her business and buy additional hogs. 

To continue her business operations, she is humbly knocking at your hearts to ask for 23,000 PHP to buy additional pigs. This will  help her earn more profit which will be used to cover daily expenses.

Milagros wants to have a better busiess and have more hogs. She also hopes to build their dream house. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business  and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and purchase hogs.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 53 years old now.

She has a abaca (palm fiber) weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber for her business.

Alejandra has been in this business for two years. In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber for her business

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en:
Sen’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom Province in Cambodia. Sen makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and certified seeds for planting

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50 years old and she supports five family members. 

She has been making several items out of soapstone for the last ten years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 11,000. 

Mary has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which she plans to buy a dairy cow to enable her get more tools for carving soapstone and earn a living out of it. 

She hopes to use anticipated profit to repay the loan and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her get more tools for carving soapstone and earn a living out of it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production, to meet the demand of her customers and the needs of her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber, nails and carpentry tools for making more chairs and tables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her farming so as to raise more income to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel 58 years old, supports a family of 4 members. 

He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 8 years earning an income of KES5,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to boost his farming through application of modern farming technology to increase production for more income. 

He plans to use the gained profits to expand his farming activity. 

His future hope is to initiate a business.

loans.use: to boost his farming through the application of modern farming technology, to increase production for more income.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 26 year old man from Kakamega. He is married, with 2 children aged 2 and 6 and supports 6 people in his family.

Andrew operates a motorbike transportation business which he has been doing for the last 4 years and generates a monthly income of Kes 18000.

He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund which he will use to purchase a new motorbike, so as to be able to support his family and expand his business. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a very hard working man from Hoima, Uganda. He started his business of dealing in produce, mainly buying and selling maize, beans, rice among other items.  He hopes to expand and develop his business into a big produce store in town, so as to achieve huge profits. 

However, his main threat is price fluctuation and bad weather. He is seeking for credit to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
Ley’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.  Ley makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Fretzie

texts.en:
Fretzie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fretzie is 36 years old and her three children are in school.

Fretzie has a business buying and selling assorted items in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy hammers and other items to sell.

Fretzie has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Fretzie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy hammers and other items to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

Rosalinda has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase nail polish, cuticle remover, nail art designs, a cotton towel, a nipper and other tools for her manicure and pedicure business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, cuticle remover, acetone, nail art designs, cotton towel, nipper and other nail salon tools.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 53 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Eugenia works very hard to provide for them.

Eugenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Eugenia has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Eugenia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Maono Bora Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Martha, a member of Maono Bora Women Group. She is sixty-six years old, married and has eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development, savings and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge of business management. Her economic activity is maize and beans farming. She needs a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer and seeds.  She hopes this will increase her level of income in order to continue supporting her family.

Martha is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laptops for her learning center.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is 34 years old, married and blessed with six children. He has been in the farming business for the last 12 years.

He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. He hopes this will enable him to grow more farm produce and earn more income to educate his children.

His future hopes are to expand his farming and be successful.

loans.use: To buy farming tools for high production.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie owns a business that buys and sells palay in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase additional sacks of palay. She is adding an extension to her business, and she wishes to earn more doing this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of palay

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil and rice to sell in the hope this will enable him to get more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for his business.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 35 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rizalina has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a married woman with ten children. She is 42 years old and has eight children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber for her business.

Florentina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Florentina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber for her weaving business

loans.name: Saturday

texts.en:
Saturday lives in Hoima Uganda. He is married with 3 children, who all attend school. He deals in produce mainly buying and selling maize, beans, rice among other items.  He supplements this income by riding a motor cycle for transport. 

He hopes to grow and expand his business, as well as educating his children. He will use the credit facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize for sell.

loans.name: Vepkhvia

texts.en:
Vepkhvia, who is 37 years old and from the village of Lashe, lives with his pensioner mother. He is involved with a small dairy farming operation, but finds it hard to satisfy even basic needs.

Vepkhvia wants to expand his agribusiness and make it more productive. For this reason, he requested a loan. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, he applied to MFO Credo for the credit. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

With the requested money, Vepkhvia plans to purchase a special tractor and start working on private orders. Especially during the season he will generate significant income and tackle financial difficulties. With the Start Up program he will get the chance to improve his family's living conditions and make a better lifestyle for his mother.

loans.use: to purchase a special tractor and start work on private orders.

loans.name: Nateete Central Market Group

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, currently in the suburb of Nateete. She is a first-time borrower and wants to take a loan of ugx500,000/= through the group. She trades vegetables and fruits in Nateete market and intends to use the loan to buy stock to boost the business. She is a hardworking lady and describes herself as a strategist. Her future plan is to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family. She greatly appreciates the efforts of the funders, especially for supporting people working hard to better the future of their families. Thank you, Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy stock of fruits and vegetables for trade

loans.name: Mithona's Group

texts.en:
Mithona’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.  

Mithona makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 36 years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from its enterprise development training. 

Her economic activity is dairy and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers to enable increase her vegetable production. Hence, she can earn more income to cater to her family's expenses at ease.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers to enable to her increase her vegetable production.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is the responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for eight years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. 

Therefore, Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Razia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. 

Razia  also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Norga Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Norga Alejandrina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace platos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Norga Alejandrina continues her business selling food.  This business is helping her succeed.  She makes dishes like roast chicken, soups, and others.  Her dream is to expand her food sales business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables, chicken, and meat.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, chicken, and meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and inputs so as to get a better harvest and meet the demands of clients and family needs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old and married to Henry, and she supports five family members. 

She has been a farmer for the last 17 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which she plans to purchase fertilizer to top-dress to her growing plants in the farm and produce a better harvest. 

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand her agricultural produce. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to top-dress her growing plants in the farm and produce a better harvest

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a businesswoman in Tudela. She is 62 years old, married and a member of PMPC from 2009.

Victoria runs a sari-sari store business. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine for making clothes

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 27 years old, married and supports four family members. He has been operating in his retail shop for the last four years and earns KES 18,000 per month.

Alex has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of household goods like sugar, flour, bread and washing soap.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hope and dream is to live stably.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods like sugar, flour, bread and washing soap

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is married and she works hard to support her family. She farms rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. 

Melba is requesting her eleventh loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Roxana De Jesús

texts.es:
Roxana de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado, ahora está acompañada y su pareja es motorista, ha procreado un hijo que tan solo tiene 1 año de edad.

Roxana es una mujer emprendedora, que a pesar de no tener estudios académicos busca la forma de salir adelante, es por ello que se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también vende comida típica los fines de semana para aportar a los gastos de su hogar, pero la mayor parte tiempo lo dedica al cuido de su hijo. 

Ella necesita la ayuda de este crédito para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda ya que no cuenta con el servicio y el resto lo utilizara para cultivar maíz. 

Sus mayores anhelos son ver prosperar su familia y vivir en mejores condiciones ya que son de escasos recursos pero sabe que eso no es impedimento para lograr todo lo que se proponga.
texts.en:
Roxana is 31 years old, with a second grade education. She is married now and her partner is a motorcyclist. They have a child who is only one year old.

Roxana is a female entrepreneur who, despite a lack of education, is looking for a way to get ahead. This is why she does housework for a living as well as selling traditional food on the weekends to contribute to the household expenses. The majority of her time is spent taking care of their son.

She needs this loan to help install electricity in her home, since she does not have this service. She will use the rest to grow corn.

Her main wishes are to see her family prosper and to live in better conditions. They have limited resources but she knows that is no obstacle to achieve everything she proposes.

loans.use: to install electricity in her home, since she does not have this service. The rest will be used to grow corn.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is a 41-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and two sons.

Seema's husband has been running his own meat business for the past 25 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and for managing the household. He wants to purchase animals for his business, but, due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these animals.

Therefore, Seema has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these animals to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also be good for him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance Seema is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his meat business.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 35-year-old woman who is the mother of three children and lives with her husband. Maia and her family are from a village, Dzegvi. 

Maia was unable to start any stable job, as there is a high unemployment rate in the region, so she started working as a private helpmeet in a family. Maia gets a really small income that is obviously hardly enough even for food for three children. 

Maia has a great desire to make income from any source to tackle the financial difficulties. She decided to start dairy farming and seek credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of GEL 1,100 for purchasing a milk cow.  After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They also use the milk products for family feeding. 

Maia and her family members rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will highly appreciate their support and kindness.

loans.use: To start agribusiness and purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Abashakamahoro Group

texts.en: Assia is the group leader, aged 55. She is married with three children aged between 28 and 35 years old. They are all married. The group is called "Abashakamahoro," which means "Peace Founder" in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change to a better future. She sells onions and has been doing business for the past 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more onions and carrots to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more onions and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Maono Bora Women Group

texts.en:
Jane, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Maono Bora Women Group. She is 29 years old, married and blessed with three children. She lives with her family. She farms maize, beans and potatoes. 

She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training she received, which equipped her with knowledge on enterprise development. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer and seeds. This will enable her to increase farm proceeds and thus earn more profits. She intends to use part of the profit in providing food for the family and to pay school fees.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will help boost farm proceeds.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia  Leonarda se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia ya tiene varios años, el sueño de la socia es tener otra tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar,aceites, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Leonarda, continues to work in her grocery store business. She sells basic goods such as a rice, sugar, milk and crackers. Through this enterprise she hopes to get ahead in life. 

She already has been working for several years in this business. Her dream is to have another grocery store. 

She asks for this loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk and crackers.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk and crackers

loans.name: Gaby Alexandra

texts.es:
La socia Gabi Alexandra se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower Gabi Alexandra raises animals for a living. Through this loan she hopes to get ahead. 

She asks for this loan to buy guinea pigs, hens and food for the guinea pigs and hens. 

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens and food for the animals.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a resident of the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She engages in making wine bottle cloth and sells it to her respective customers.  She is 51 year old with three children. Her youngest child is 15. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years now.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to acquire additional capital. She can then purchase materials to produce more quantities of wine bottle cloth.
