In this way, her income will be augmented and enables her to handle finances. She could then provide her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions.

In the future, Nelia would be able to expand her business for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to  acquire additional capital

loans.name: Eva Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con su sonrisa y gran corazón, Eva ha tenido una gran acogida en su barrio desde que abrió su restaurante hace 6 años con gran esfuerzo y con un deseo en su mente, el de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos e ingredientes como harina, maíz, carne, pollo, aliños, entre otros.

Con estos ingredientes podrá continuar cocinando y preparando las delicias que con sus manos trabajadoras  y su empuje ha venido ofreciendo y sirviendo.
Su principal dificultad es el Alto costo de los insumos.

Apoya a Eva con su negocio y has que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo!
texts.en:
With her smile and big heart, Eva has had a big welcome in her neighborhood since she opened her restaurant 6 years ago with great effort and a desire in mind, to get ahead and improve her family's living conditions.

The loan that she requests is to purchase supplies and ingredients such as flour, corn, meat, chicken, seasonings, and more.

With these ingredients, she will be able to continue cooking and preparing the delicacies that with her working hands and her drive she has been offering and serving.

Her primary difficulty is the high cost of supplies.

Support Eva with her business and make her live better with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients such as flour, corn, meat, chicken, seasonings, and more.

loans.name: Carlos Maria

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre soltero, se desempeña como maestro de obra, dicha profesión le ha permitido generar los recursos para mantener a sus dos hijas de 11 y 9 años de edad las cuales son su mayor adoración. 
El objetivo de Carlos es lograr contratos para mantener a sus hijas en buenas condiciones, pues se preocupa mucho por el que pueda pasar, porque estén bien, que no les falte nada, que tengan todas las herramientas para desarrollar su personalidad y decidió entregar todo de él por ellas.

Como maestro de obra tiene que tener la herramienta apropiada para realizar cada trabajo, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar alguna herramienta que de momento no tiene, como lo son una caneca especial para revolver cemento, palustre, almádana, destornillos imantados, y otras herramientas especiales para construir muros y vigas.
texts.en:
Carlos is a single man and works as a master builder, this profession has allowed him to generate the resources to support his two daughters, ages 11 and 9, who are his greatest devotion.

Carlos's objective to to get contracts to support his daughters in better condition, since he worries a lot about what could happen to them, so that they are well, that they don't lack anything, that they have all the tools to develop their personality and he decided to give his all to them.  

As a master builder, he has to have the appropriate tools to do each job. So, he wants to ask for a loan to purchase some tools that at the moment he doesn't have, such as a special container to mix cement, trowel, sledgehammer, magnetic screwdriver, and tools to build walls and beams.

loans.use: to purchase a special container to mix cement, trowel, sledgehammer, magnetic screwdriver, and tools to build walls and beams.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para realizar la compra de materia prima y utensilios de panadería.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas.
Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada y eficiente.
texts.en:
Maria has a lot of experience in bakeries, some time ago she began her own bakery that, to date, has generated very good results.

She has always preferred to work independently, she works every day from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm.

Currently she needs a loan to purchase raw materials and bakery tools. 

The loan will allow her to work in better conditions and she will be able to guarantee the quality of her products. 

Her greatest dream is to be able to have a big bakery that supplies different stores. 

With this help, she will be able to work in a more organized and efficient way.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and utensils for her bakery.

loans.name: Gabriel Angel

texts.es:
Gabriel es un hombre de 70 años de edad que ha librado mil y un batallas a lo largo de su vida, algunas ganadas otras perdidas y unas bajas sensibles como lo fue el fallecimiento de su esposa, quedando solo, puesto que sus 4 hijos tienen su respectiva familia y aunque lo visitan no lo hacen muy seguido.

Este gran hombre genera sus recursos para su mantenimiento gracias a una chaza de alimentos, donde oferta dulces, minutos a celular, bebidas, papas en bolsa etc., y no solo representa un ingresos para ayudarle con el pago de sus deudas si no que gracias a las maravillosas personas que ha conocido en la calle ha podido ir superando la pérdida de su esposa puesto que no se siente tan solo.

Gabriel quiere solicitar un préstamo que usara para la compra de mercancía en bolis, refrescos, papas en bolsa, bom bom bum, confites etc, este préstamo le ayudara para el sostenimiento de su negocio permitiendo trabajar, pagar él mismo sus deudas y seguir compartiendo con sus amigos en su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a 70-year-old man who has fought a thousand and one battles throughout his life, some won and others lost, and some emotional blows such as the death of his wife, leaving him alone, since his 4 children have their own families and although they visit him, they don't do it very frequently. 

This great man generates the income to support himself thanks to a food cart where he sells candies, cell phone minutes, drinks, potato chips, etc., and it doesn't only represent an income to help him pay his debts but also, thanks to the marvelous people he has met in the street, he has managed to overcome the loss of his wife because he doesn't feel so alone. 

Gabriel wants to ask for a loan that he will use to purchase merchandise such as bolis [iced snacks made from fruit juice], soft drinks, potato chips, lollipops, candies, etc. This loan will help him sustain the business, allowing him to work, pay off his own debts, and continue sharing with his friends in his workplace.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise of bolis [iced snacks made of fruit juice], soft drinks, bags of potato chips, lollipops and sweets.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 52 years old and lives in Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 5 adult children. She is good at her farming activities and has had this business for many years. 

She requested a loan to pay for the labor costs to clear and plow land and plant seedlings on her coconut farm.  Also to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. 

In the future, Lucila hopes to engage in a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs to clear and plow land and plant seedlings on her coconut farm. Also to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, ahora está casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas, juntos han procreado 3 hijos de los cuales los dos menores asisten a la escuela. 

La agricultura es la principal actividad productiva de Roberto, desde hace 6 años, él siembra maíz y frijol, además tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad con la cual abastece a las personas de su comunidad, anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la venta de ganado pero decidió abrirse a nuevas oportunidades. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y herbicidas, ya que está por comenzar el invierno y quiere estar preparado para los cultivos. 

Él espera seguir trabajando en la agricultura y además solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de ganado de repasto.
texts.en:
Roberto is forty-four years old, he attended school until the sixth grade. Now he is married and his wife sells tortillas. They have three children together, the youngest two attend school. 

Agriculture is Roberto's main work. He has grown corn and beans for the past six years. He also has a store selling basic supplies which serves his community. Before he only worked selling livestock, but he decided to try new opportunities. 

He needs the loan to purchase fertilizers and herbicides, since winter is about to begin and he wants to be prepared for planting. 

He wants to continue working in agriculture, and also to solicit a new loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides, since winter is about to begin and he wants to be prepared for planting.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 47 years old, a spinster. She is a professional cook who lives in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. She has worked as a cook since 2004, and can earn approximately $8 per day.

Srey’s present house is old, and she would like to buy construction materials to renovate her house. She doesn’t have enough finances, so she needs a loan.

With this loan, she will be able to have a proper house for her family for better living conditions. In the future, she wants to save money to run her own business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 31-year-old Palestinian man who has been working as a taxi driver for eight years. Due to the low financial and social living conditions of Palestinians in Lebanon, and their limited access to many jobs, he is trying desperately hard to develop his business and improve his living conditions.

Mohammad is engaged, dreaming of his wedding and the beautiful life with his future wife. Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to complete building his house in order to make the dream comes true.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and provide his future family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to complete building his house in order to make his dream comes true

loans.name: Niceforo

texts.es:
El socio Niceforo  pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio continua dedicándose  al negocio de maestro de construcciones socio es una persona responsable  y empeñoso, él socio continua realizando trabajos de casas, pintados entre otros, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Niceforo belongs to the "Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa" communal bank. It is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

He continues to work as a master builder and he is a responsible and diligent person. He continues to do work on houses, such as painting, among other things. Niceforo hopes to continue working so that he can keep supporting his family. He is requesting the loan to buy tools. 

He is grateful for the loan and he promises to comply with the payment plan.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a goal oriented woman. She was born in a family of workers in 1996. She is single and lives with her parents. 

She participated in the training  for “Woman Entrepreneur-Achieve Success” provided by IMON. She planned to start a new business. 

She cooks well and decided to buy an oven. She is asking a loan from KIVA lenders to buy an oven and products needed to start her business. She is planning to cook tasty cakes, pancakes, sweets, etc. 

She hopes to be financed. Her mother will support her and help her to start a business. She knows that her business will succeed.

loans.use: To buy an oven and products needed to start her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production for his customers. To meet their demands and family needs.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion, 55 years old, supports a family of six members.

He has been practicing tea farming for the last 15 years and earns KES 15,000 per month. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve his farming through modern farming to increase production for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his farming and to educate his children.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to improve his farming through modern farming to increase production for more income gain.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 29 years old and married with two children who are both in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Joan is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Joan has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Walter Eduardo

texts.es:
Walter ha tenido que soportar muchísimas adversidades en el proceso de desarrollo de su negocio.
Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa y se gana la vida vendiendo acolchados, ropa, entre otros, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para su hijo.

Le dedica 4 horas diarias a su negocio.

El solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de perfumería, calzado, entre otros al por mayor para tener mejor inventario.

Con este préstamo puede ofrecer sus productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.

Es un hombre fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en: Walter has had to face many adversities in the process of developing his business. Nowadays, he lives in a modest house and earns his living by selling quilted covers and clothes, among other things, a job he learned by experience in order to support his son. He works 4 hours a day in his business. He is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, footwear, among other things, at wholesale prices in order to have a better inventory. With this loan he will be able to offer his products and improve his sales considerably. He is a strong man of great enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, footwear, and other things at wholesale prices in order to have a better inventory.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina a sus 22 años de edad, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo y por necesidad económica se motiva a independizarse y conseguir ingresos por su cuenta, por eso desea iniciar un negocio de comidas rápidas que estará ubicado en una esquina muy transitada del barrio donde reside en municipio de Puerto Salgar.

Ella desea ofrecer en su negocio arepas de queso, patacones de plátano, chorizos con arepa, butifarras, arepas de chócolo, gaseosas entre otros, con esto espera conseguir los recursos necesarios para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. 

Carolina es una señora trabajadora, pujante, emprendedora, solicita el crédito como apoyo para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (sillas, carpa) e insumos para elaborar los alimentos (carnes frías, aceite, arepas, plátanos, gaseosas) para tener disponibilidad y variedad de productos que satisfagan los gustos de todos sus clientes, de esta forma podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.

Gracias al apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar y a los prestamistas de Kiva podrá montar este negocio y conseguirá ser independiente.
texts.en:
Carolina, 22, wants to start her own business because no one is hiring in her area and she needs an income. She chose to start selling food to go on a street corner with lots of pedestrian traffic in her neighbourhood in the town of Puerto Salgar.

She plans to sell maize flatbread filled with cheese, fried plantain slices, sausages and maize flatbread, botifarra, maize flatbread filled with maize, soft drinks, etc. She hopes the income she will derive from this activity will be enough to cover basic expenses. 

Carolina is hard-working, full of fighting spirit, and business-savvy. She asks for a loan in order to buy fixed assets (chairs and a tent) as well as ingredients to prepare the food (cold cuts, cooking oil, maize flatbread, plantain, soft drinks). Her goal is to have a decent stock in order to meet customer demand. Thus, she will enjoy a better standard of living and wellbeing.

Thanks to Interactuar and Kiva lenders, Carolina will be able to start her own business and support herself.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets and ingredients.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Luis es un hombre de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de La Dorada con su esposa y su hija menor de edad.

El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de pescado. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas solo.

El ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y cuando un cliente le hace un pedido, intenta satisfacer su necesidad a toda cabalidad. 

Manifiesta que es un negocio sencillo de realizar para su edad.
El solicita un préstamo para compra de un congelador nuevo para albergar sus pescados.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para la educación y sostenimiento de su hija.
texts.en:
Luis is a man of a thousand experiences in his life. He lives in the municipality of La Dorado with his wife and his minor daughter. He is a hard-working man who for some time has been engaged in the business of selling fish. He works every day for 10 hours.

He offers his products itinerantly and when a client requests an order he tries to fill it to perfection. He says that it s an easy business for someone his age.

He is requesting a loan to buy a new freezer to keep his fish. The loan will give him the opportunity to capitalize his business and add a considerable boost to his business. This will allow him to obtain the resources for the education an sustenance of his children

loans.use: to buy a new freezer to store his fish.

loans.name: Khadijah

texts.en:
Khadijah is a married woman with six children. She is an example of the woman who has willpower, ambition and optimism, and she is really working hard to be a productive woman and provide good education to her children and help her husband pay for the household expenses.

Ten years ago, she started her business, which is breeding goats and making dairy products such as cheese. She gets a good income from this work, but day after day her children are getting bigger and their needs have increased. Therefore, she decided to develop her business.

Khadijah decided to request a loan to introduce technology to her work and buy a machine to make her products, thus increasing her income, so that she will become able to help her family more and more.

loans.use: to introduce technology to her work and buy a machine to make her products

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Mrs Siti, has a family of four and lives in a village called Pakis in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia nobody can drink city water, and most people have not even access to piped water, therefore most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs Siti heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. 

Mrs Siti who is also a midwife took the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. Mrs Siti already collected orders and small down payments of almost 100 people. Her clients pay back in 8 installments so that even poor people can afford to have a purifier in their home.Making safe drinking water available to 500 people.
Mrs Siti will use this loan to buy around 100 water filters from Nazava that she will sell on credit to her neighbors. 
This loan is larger then usual for a starting entrepreneur because mrs Siti already collected so many downpayments and because she is visited weekly by Nazava's sales team which provides oversight.

loans.use: to provide her neighbourhood with clean drinking water by buying water filters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water filters to  provide safe drinking water to Indonesian Urbanites

loans.name: Rudianto

texts.en:
Mr Rudianto lives in Kuantan, in Riau province on Sumatra Island with his wife and children

Rudianto explains himself how and why he became a reseller of Nazava water filters: “One of the basic daily needs for all living beings, in this world is water. Without water, there is no possibility of life in the world."

Rudianto is one of our Nazava's most successful reseller and he is very active at the Nazava reseller Whatsapp group. His creative ideas help other water filter sellers move forward. Rudianto pioneered the try first, then buy system in which mothers (yes only mothers) can get a water purifier in their house and they only have to pay after a month and only when they are 100 % satisfied.  Rudianto uses KIVA to finance this very successful system. 

With this loan Rudianto, can buy up to 300 filters which help hem provide safe drinking water to around 1500 people.

loans.use: to buy water filters to provide more people with safe drinking water on the Island of Sumatera, Indonesia

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a proud United States veteran, and a devoted husband and father to his wife and two children. Justin is in the process of transitioning from military to civilian life, and is currently working full time to support his family. Justin works to help retired and disabled veterans obtain counseling and necessary benefits to help them transition back to a civilian life. 

Although Justin is tirelessly working to provide for his family, he has recently suffered financial setbacks that have negatively affected his credit. The air conditioning unit in their home is broken, and Justin has been unable to obtain financing for a new unit. With Florida’s temperatures rising in the upcoming summer months, Justin’s family — especially the two young children — will very much benefit in regards to their health and quality of life by installing a new energy efficient air conditioner in their home.  

Due to Justin’s recent financial distress, he has turned to SELF and Kiva for help, as he has no other alternative to provide a new unit for his family. As a veteran, Justin is part of the “SELF - Veterans Helping Veterans Program,” and his installation will be done by another veteran who will benefit from the job as well.  

Justin will use his Kiva loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner, which will provide his family with a healthier and overall better life in their home.

loans.use: to purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner, which will provide his family with a healthier and overall better life in their home.

loans.name: Wawan

texts.en:
Mr Wawan is living with his wife in Sukabumi, a town in the hills of West Java. His children are already grown up. 

Even though it precipitation is very high, all drinking water in Indonesia is contaminated with bacteria. That is why Wawan started to sell safe drinking water filters from Nazava so people can drink water from their well without boiling it. Wawan has been selling Nazava water filters for eight months now and he is has been  successful. He started this business by introducing and promoting the filters to co-workers, neighbors and people he knew. Wawan is very optimistic about his business he plans to sell more in remote areas and also work together with community organizations. With this loan Wawan can buy up to 70 filters which will help him provide safe drinking water to around 350 people.

loans.use: to buy up to 70 filters which will help him provide safe drinking water to around 350 people.

loans.name: Hidayat

texts.en:
Hidayat is just married and lives in the Northernmost point of Indonesia in Banda Aceh. 

Hidayat wants to become a reseller to earn some money for his young family and also because: 

"I want that my family, my friends and all people in Banda Aceh and Aceh experience the great benefit delivered by using Nazava Water Purifiers that turn dirty water into drinking water without the need of boiling, with a very affordable price and they are easy to use.  I want that people are not anymore dependent on buying (or boiling) water but can instead filter their own water. "

This loan will provide Hidayat with about 35 filters that in turn can provide safe drinking water to over 100 people.

loans.use: to buy water purifiers start selling water filters in Banda Aceh, Indonesia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water filters to improve access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Za`farbi

texts.en:
Za`farbi is very hardworking woman. She is 49 years old, lives with her husband and a daughter, 3 sons and a daughter-in law, in the district of Vose. 

Za`farbi, with her husband, is engaged in beekeeping. They have 8 years experience in it. They are working day and night to improve their life. In this activity their children are helping them. 

Now Za`farbi wants to develop her income. She decided to increase the count of bees.  But unfortunate she does not have enough money to realize her plans. For this reason Za`farbi is asking for the loan. Your support is very important for her.

loans.use: To increase the count of bees and develop her income.

loans.name: Miguel Arcangel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba., perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
 El socio es el Sr. Miguel Arcángel; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al transporte de cargas, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
 El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento del carro. 
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Miguel Arcangel belongs to the communal bank SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA; the bank is located in the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. 
Miguel Arcangel makes deliveries. He has worked in this business for quite a while, and it is going well thanks to the hard work he puts in every day. He is a responsible, dedicated person, and in this way he is moving his family ahead. 
Miguel is requesting this loan to perform maintenance on his car. 
He is grateful for the loan, and promises to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia, 53, is a widow and lives in Tangub. From her desire to help her family, she engaged in dried fish vending starting up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. It has operated for 6 years already. Now, she is planning to borrow  PHP 50,000 as additional working capital for her existing business from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she  became a member in 2010. The loan is intended to purchase more inventory of dried fish that she can supply to her buyer-sellers. Someday, Letecia wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish. She deeply wishes to expand and renovate her house, and live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of dried fish that she can supply to her buyer-sellers

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita hails from Javier, Leyte. She is 45 year old, married, with eight children. Five of her children are still attending school:ages 19-8 years old respectively. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities ranging from biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, special ice candy, shampoo, eggs, seasonings, soft drinks and toiletries. She is in need of funds to continue operating her existing business.

She is asking for a loan to purchase additional stocks for the store. These will fill her store contents and will attract more buyers to come and shop. In this way, her income will be augmented and she will be able to pay her obligations. 

She dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for the store

loans.name: Ruthchel

texts.en:
Ruthchel is 30 years old, married and has one child to provide for. To earn a living, she is engaged in fishing together with her husband. They need financial assistance to purchase additional net for fishing to be able to catch more fish so that they can sell more fish in the market.

Ruthchel wants to buy a new fishing boat to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additonal net for fishing.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. He has been a dairy farmer for the last 20 years.

He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to buy a dairy cow for milk production and hopes this will enable him to supply more milk and make more income to educate his children.

His future hopes are to expand his dairy farm by adding more dairy cows and supply more milk.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to enable him to supply more milk and make more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Tibenda William

texts.en: William is a fifty-four-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married with ten children and is a very hardworking man. He has managed to support his family and hopes to buy land from the proceeds of his business. Being affected by inadequate capital, he wants a loan to buy more stock for his business.

loans.use: To buy stock like sugar, soap and other items to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Arnovis Enrique

texts.es:
Arnovis, residente de la zona de Sincelejo donde la mejor manera de salir adelante y criar a sus hijos es el emprendimiento ya que el trabajo es algo difícil de conseguir, Arnovis es un hombre pujante, luchador, muy responsable, vende productos de la canasta familiar, aprendió trabajando para un vecino al cual le agradece mucho pues lo motivo y lo impulso para que montara su propia tienda para generar mejores recursos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, que lo conforman dos hijos una de 9 y otro de 1 año de edad.

Trabaja toda la semana, 8 horas por día, el quiere mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, pero el principal impedimento para crecer ha sido la falta de capital para invertir en nueva y variada mercancía. 

Arnovis quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con productos como arroz, panela, arepas, lentejas, pastas, frijoles, aceite de cocina, mantequilla, chocolate, huevo, café que son productos por lo general de diario consumo en las familias antioqueñas.
texts.en:
Arnovis, resident from the Sincelejo area where the best way to be successful and raise your children is through entrepreneurship as work is hard to find. 

Arnovis is a vibrant, hard working and responsible man. He sells everyday grocery items. 

He learned by working for a neighbor who he is very appreciative of because they motivated him to set up his own store in order to generate a better income to maintain his home. He has two children aged 9 and 1. 

He works for days straight during the week for 8 hours a day. 

He wants to improve his sales, increase his clientele and improve his usefulness. However his main hurdle for growth had been the lack of capital to invest in new and varied merchandise. He wants to supply his business with products such as: rice, cane sugar, arepas [corn cakes], lentils, pasta, beans, cooking oil, butter, chocolate, eggs and coffee. These are all products the the general population consumes on a daily basis.

loans.use: to supply his business with products such as: rice, cane sugar, arepas [corn cakes], lentils, pasta, beans, cooking oil.

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es:
María, de 36 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, porque siempre se dedico a la agricultura, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos que van a la escuela, ella solo vive con sus hijos.

María, tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura, ya que esa fue la actividad que aprendió de sus padres, además trabaja vendiendo comida típica en las calles de el cantón, la parcela donde ella trabaja está a 1 kilómetro de su casa, la venta de comida típica la realiza 3 veces por semana y la parcela la visita todos los días en temporada de siembra.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, venenos, pesticidas, entre otros insumos agrícolas para sembrar.

El sueño de María es, ir arreglando su casa poco a poco, mediante las ganancias que le generen la siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old. She did not go to school, because she has always done farm work. She is a single mother with two children who go to school. She lives only with her children.

She has years of experience in agriculture since this is the work she learned from her parents. The plot of land where she works is located one kilometer away from her home, and she goes there every day during the planting season. 

She also works selling traditional food as a street vendor in the canton, and she does this three times per week.

Maria needs the loan to buy compost, weed killers, pesticides, and other inputs for planting.

Her dream is to gradually improve her home with the earnings obtained from her corn crops.

loans.use: to buy compost, weed killers, pesticides, and other agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria de 61 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 14 hijos de los cuales solo 3 viven con ella y 3 nietos.

Victoria se dedica a los oficios domésticos, de manera que siempre trata de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pues ellos se caracterizan por ser una familia trabajadora.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos para realizar trabajos agrícolas, ya que el invierno está por comenzar y buscan obtener una buena cosecha.

Ella sueña con seguir apoyando a su familia y espera que la vida le dé la oportunidad de ver crecer a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 61, did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She is married and her husband works in agriculture.  She has fourteen children, three of whom live with her, along with three grandchildren.  

Victoria takes care of the home, as well as always trying to support her husband by helping with the household expenses. They are a hardworking family.  

She needs the loan to purchase supplies to finish agricultural tasks.  Winter is about to begin and they are looking forward to a good harvest. She dreams of continuing to support her family and hopes that life gives her the opportunity to see her grandchildren grow up.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to complete agricultural jobs.  Winter is coming and she hopes to have a good crop.

loans.name: Lay Eaing Kone

texts.en:
Located in Lay Eaing Kone, in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region.  Lay Eaing Kone has a population of approximately 500. The group has five CBO (Community Based Organization) members, overseeing a group of forty-two village customers. Rice farming is the main activity in this village. 

This loan will help some group members purchase fertilizers, crop seeds, rent farming equipment and petrol. In this region, rice farming can only be done one season, the rainy season, per year. Therefore, families in this village also have additional income sources to ease family financial issues.  This includes either livestock such as pigs and ducks, or seasonal plantation such as calabash trees and betel trees.

Pictured above are CBO members from Lay Eaing Kone Village group, named (From left to right) Than, Myint, Kyaw and Thein. Than is part of a family that has farmed for generations. He and his family have to struggle just to live day-to-day life because their main income comes from farming one season per year.  This is less than other areas in the Myanmar Delta, where rainfall permits farming for two seasons per year. Than's family also faces risks such as over-flooding of his paddy field from excessive rain.

The loan from Proximity will help Than buy much needed fertilizers, pesticides and hire laborers.  Hired labor is important to increase yield from his paddy production. Than is proud to be a father of four children and supports his youngest son's education, who is in his final year at Yangon Institute of Technology. Increased income from Proximity's loan will help Than expand his farm business and pay the remaining expenses for his son's education.

loans.use: To purchase crop inputs such as petrol and fertilizer, as well as hire laborers

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is 51 years old, married, and has one child. She operates a tailoring business from her house, which she has been doing for 30 years to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Sanaa is an ambitious woman and a hard worker who has a good reputation among her region and is well-known for her professional tailoring skills. She is trying hard to develop her business.

Sanaa requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to buy a knitting machine to create knitted fabrics in a semi or fully automated fashion in order to provide her customers with new collections and satisfy their special needs. She hopes to open her own tailoring shop in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a knitting machine to create knitted fabrics

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is 55 years old and a widow. She lives with her three children in Maquilao, Tangub. For twenty-five years, Eliza and her husband were farmers. She earns 15,000 PHP each cropping focusing on her rice farm. When she became widowed, she continued doing her farming activities to earn a living. Eliza became an active member of PMPC in 2012. She is now requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business to uplift the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have a heavier and higher crop yield on her rice farm

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres San Juanera Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres San Juanera
Este dúo es conformado por la señora Claudia originaria de San Juan, quien es casada y madre de 3 niños, sigue en la venta y distribución del producto nutricional muy conocido en la localidad de San Juan Sacatepéquez (onmilife) doña Claudia sigue manteniendo sus ventas en cantidades mayores y a la vez brinda capacitación y asesoría a muchas personas en el uso de estos productos, motivo por el cual siempre requiere de capital para lograr mantener diversidad de productos que ofrece la empresa, de esta manera doña Claudia sigue teniendo un ingreso económico muy apreciativo que la hace sentirse motivada a servir y seguir esforzando por su familia.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos medicinales(onmilife)
texts.en:
Mujeres San Juanera duo.

Claudia is part of this duo. She is originally from San Juan. She is married and has three children. Claudia sells nutritional products from a brand that is well-known locally: Omnilife. She sells large quantities and teaches people about how to use these products.

Claudia needs capital in order to be able to offer a wide variety of products. Thanks to this business, she receives a good income, which motivates her to continue working for the sake of her family.

Claudia is requesting a loan to buy Omnilife medicinal products.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife medicinal products to sell.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; La socia es la Sra. Hilda; la socia  tiene 39 años de edad es soltera y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose al  negocio de venta de quesos, la socia vende los quesos  a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar quesos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Hilda belongs to the “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA” communal bank. She is 39 years old, single and has 3 children. She combines her daily activities with her business selling cheese. She sells cheese to all the clients that request it. She has had this business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her work each day. This is the way she gets her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy cheese. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with paying the installments of her loan.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farming by employing modern farming methods and increase productivity in order to raise more income.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 52 years old, married and he supports 5 family members. He has been operating his butchery for the last 7 years and the business earns KES16,000 per month.

Gabriel has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy butchery tools and equipment for ease and efficient work. 

He plans to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and be a large scale farmer. 

His future hopes and dreams are to lead in charcoal supply in the area.

loans.use: to buy butchery tools and equipment

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor, 45 years old, is a married mother who has two dependent children and one of them is in school. She is a resident in a rural area located in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. The sources of her family’s income have been from rice farming, fishing and feeding pigs for more than 10 years. Depending on her current business, she could earn around 100,000KHR per day to support her family’s needs.
 
Sor’s Group consists of two members, and this is the ninth loan for her with VisionFund. The previous loans help her to have a better living condition. 

Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan, with the portion to buy farming supplies to do the farm. 

She hopes that she could earn more income to expand her current business and get the ability to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 42 years old, married and has three children. 

Teresa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresa has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 25 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She sells phone accessories to generate more income to support her family. She is affected by inadequate capital though she works hard to sustain her business.

Annet requested a loan, which she will use to buy more phone accessories to sell. She hopes to buy her own land and construct a house.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is 39 years old, married, and has five children who attend school. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 13 years. She earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Nelda requested her eleventh loan from NWTF for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries. Nelda hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build an electric pump at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
la socia Julia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de tamales,biscochuelos y maicillos que son como pasteles hechos a base de maiz,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos como harina,azucar,manteca y huevos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julia continues to work in the sale of tamales, baked desserts and maicillos, which are corn cakes.  She is a hard working woman and a fighter. Through this business she hopes to help her family move forward.  

She is asking for the credit to purchase supplies such as flour, sugar, lard and eggs.  She is happy about the loan and promises to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour, sugar, lard and eggs.

loans.name: Sameth

texts.en:
Sameth is 41 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She resides in the province of Kampong Speu in Cambodia. She is currently working in a factory, which she has been doing since 2010. Her husband is a construction foreman. She and her husband earn around $15 per day. 

Sameth requested a loan for her husband, which he will use to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, and steel for his construction work. In the future, she wants to buy soil to fill under her house and help her children finish high school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as bricks, cement, and steel

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 55 years old and he supports 8 family members. He has been a farmer for the last 20 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 11,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to purchase a cow for milk production and meet the demand of his customers and become a mixed farmer. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children. 
His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production and meet the demand of his customers and become a mixed farmer.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José es un hombre trabajador de veinticuatro años de edad, se dedica a ser mecánico de automóviles, motocicletas y bicicletas. Desde muy joven encontró su pasión por el mundo de la mecánica, su madre quien siempre lo apoyado, lo impulso para que pusiera su propio pequeño negocio, además con ayuda de un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito logro comprar herramientas básicas para desempeñar su trabajo. Él está muy agradecido la confianza que le fue dada en este primer financiamiento. 
En estos momentos, José, vuelve a recurrir  a Kiva junto a MiCrédito esta vez solicitando un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de repuestos para bicicletas, dado que en su negocio los clientes están demandando mucho dichos productos. Él trabaja muy fuerte para mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia. En un futuro piensa ampliarse y poner una tienda de repuestos y bicicletas.
texts.en:
José, 24, is a hardworking man. He is a mechanic and works repairing cars, motorcycles and bicycles. Already from a young age, José realized he loved mechanics. His mother, who has always supported him, encouraged him to open his own business. With help from a Kiva and MiCrédito loan, he could buy the basic tools he needed to do his job. He appreciates the trust put in him with the first loan.

José is requesting a Kiva and MiCrédito loan again. This time, he needs to buy bicycle replacement parts in order to fulfill the growing demand. He works very hard to improve his and his family’s living conditions. In the future, he would like to expand his business and open a bicycle shop.

loans.use: to buy bicycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Marites is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to resell.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Alma Marisol

texts.es:
Alma es una mujer emprendedora de 35 años de edad, está soltera y vive con un hermano y su madre y ambos dependen de ella. 

Alma se dedica a la contabilidad, ella trabaja en una empresa de repuestos para vehículos, anteriormente, trabajaba en un colegio también como contador, de modo que no se ha detenido para poner en práctica lo que ha aprendido a lo largo de sus estudios

Este crédito lo está solicitado para comprar materiales para mejorar el techo y las paredes de su vivienda. 

A Alma solamente le hace falta un ciclo de clases en la universidad, por lo tanto su sueño más grande es poder finalizar para obtener su título como licenciada en contabilidad.
texts.en: Alma is an enterprising 35 year old woman. She is single and lives with her brother and her mother, both of whom depend on her. Alma works as an accountant for a car parts company. Previously she worked in a college also as an accountant. So she hasn't stopped doing the work that she learned throughout her studies. The loan she is requesting is to buy materials to improve the roof and walls of her house. Alma is only lacking one semester of classes at university, so her greatest dream is to finish it and obtain her degree as a Licensed Accountant.

loans.use: to buy material to improve the roof and walls of her house.

loans.name: Ndengelika Small Bussines Self Help Group

texts.en:
The man holding a passbook with his hand in the photo is James. He is 62 years old, married and blessed with seven children. His group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from its training on group mobilization, savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management.The group members are involved in activities such as table banking and merry-go-round.

James practices mixed farming growing maize, beans, and vegetables. He also has dairy cows from which he sells milk. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed which will help increase milk production for more income to meet his family expenses with ease. 

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed which will help increase milk production for more income to meet his family expenses.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a new client with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. She is married, has four children and five dependents who all live with her. She does small scale agriculture to make income to meet the family's financial obligations.  

But they are so many, she decided to venture into brick production, having realized the need for bricks by the many upcoming house constructors. 

She is therefore requesting the loan to buy wood to burn to make bricks, that she will sell to her clients. She is hard working and shrewd and thanks Kiva lenders, in partnership with UGAFODE, for supporting her to overcome poverty.

loans.use: To make bricks for construction.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 30 years-old single man from Rafah city. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a small income. Sami also has a store for selling electrical devices and repair parts. It has been opened for the past three years. 
Sami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his electrical store to resell. This will increase his sales and also his income. 
Sami appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products for his electrical store to resell

loans.name: Seleccion Group

texts.es:
En un municipio de Oaxaca la actividad económica se divide entre la producción de caña de azúcar y la pesca llevada a cabo en la gran presa que ocupa la mayor parte del territorio. Otra actividad importante es la elaboración de trajes tradicionales que realizan mujeres de origen mazateco. 
   Selección es el nombre de un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras formado en el centro del municipio sus actividades son: María – Estética; Efigenia - Agua Purificada; Natalia - Frutas Y Agua De Frutas; Julia, Rosalía, Mónica – Abarrotes; Domitila – Comida; Fidelina – Zapatos; Obdulia – Sastrería; María Isabel – Taquería; Ofelia – Pollo; Alma –Mojarra; Adriana – Ropa. 
    La señora María se ha dedicado a realizar cortes de cabello desde hace treinta y cuatro años en un local dentro del mercado del municipio, todos sus conocidos le dicen Mari de cariño. Comenzó en el oficio pues su madre era quien se encargaba de cortar el cabello a toda la familia y le enseñó lo que sabía, posteriormente se inscribió en cursos lo que le ayudó a adquirir más técnica y experiencia. 
   Doña Mari es madre de cuatro hijos a los que pudo brindar educación gracias al esfuerzo dedicado en su labor de estilista, ahora disfruta estar con sus cinco nietos que la visitan en su local. Mari también ayuda a personas que deseen formar su propio negocio pues ha impartido varios cursos en donde transmite sus conocimientos de estilismo. 
   Anteriormente Doña Mari ha invertido préstamos y ganancias en instrumentos necesarios para su actividad como peines, tintes, máquinas de rasurar y una secadora. Actualmente necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar tijeras, tintes, talco, capas, brochas y una secadora nueva. Con las ganancias pretende remodelar su local para hacerlo más atractivo a los clientes.
   El grupo Selección expresa: “Gracias a VisionFund México por habernos brindando una oportunidad de crecimiento y por motivarnos a seguir adelante”

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de la señora Julia, Doña Mari es quien trae el delantal floreado.
texts.en:
In a town in Oaxaca, economic activity is divided between the production of sugar cane and fishing carried out in the large reservoir that occupies most of the area. Another important activity is the production of traditional costumes, which are made by women of Mazatec origin.

Selección [Team] is the name of a group of women entrepreneurs in the town center. Their activities are the following: María - Beauty salon; Efigenia - Purified water; Natalia - Fruit and drinks made with water and fresh fruit; Julia, Rosalía, Mónica - Groceries; Domitila - Food; Fidelina - Shoes; Obdulia - Tailoring; María Isabel - Tacos; Ofelia - Chicken; Alma - Fish; Adriana - Clothing.

María has spent thirty-four years cutting hair the town market. Everyone who knows her speaks of her with affection. She started in this profession because her mother was the one who cut the hair of everyone in her family, and she taught María what she knew. Then María enrolled in courses that helped her gain more skill and experience.

Mari is the mother of four children, whom she was able to provide with an education thanks to the efforts that she dedicated to her work as a stylist. Now she enjoys being with her five grandchildren, who visit her in her salon. Mari also helps people who want to start their own business; she has taught several courses in which she has shared her knowledge of styling.

 Mari has previously invested loans and profits in tools needed for her business, such as combs, dyes, electric razors, and a dryer. Now she needs a new loan to buy scissors, dyes, talc, capes, brushes, and a new dryer. With her profits she plans to remodel her salon to make it more attractive to customers.

The Selección group says: "Thanks to VisionFund Mexico for providing us an opportunity for growth and motivating us to move forward."

* The photograph was taken at Julia’s store. Mari is the one wearing the flowered apron.

loans.use: to buy scissors, dyes, talc, capes, brushes, and a new dryer.

loans.name: Mya Lay Yone Village

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Mya Lay Yone, named Aung, Hla, Hte, Sein and Hte M. The Featured Borrower, Hla (in the middle) , has a five acre farm in the Delta region of Myanmar and like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season.  Hla is part of a family that has farmed for generations and farming runs in Hla's blood. The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs before harvest. Also, Hla hopes to plant betel nut trees for the next season, which will increase his income. Hla is 55 years old, married, and supports a family of six (four children), the oldest of whom is getting a higher education. Part of the family’s income goes towards funding the childrens’ education. 
 
The CBO leaders oversee a group of 28 borrowers in their village.  The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time.  Mya Lay Yone Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal foods. They also raise livestock such as ducks and pigs, for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase petrol for farm equipment, fertilizer and renting farming equipment

loans.name: Gloria Magdalena

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 27 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 7° grado, ahora está casada y su esposo es agricultor, en su matrimonio ha procreado dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad los cuales asisten al centro escolar de la comunidad. 

Gloria es una mujer de hogar, es por ello que se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero además vende productos de revista muy populares y reconocidas, entre esos productos están perfumes y prendas de vestir, de esta forma apoya a su esposo para cubrir con los gastos de los trabajos agrícolas que él realiza. 

Ella solicita este crédito para terminar de cubrir los gastos de los trabajos agrícolas y el resto para realizar mejoras en su vivienda.

Su sueño es continuar trabajando muy duro junto a su esposo ya que sueña con ver crecer a sus hijos y darles una buena educación, pues ella no tuvo esa oportunidad y considera que es indispensable que sus hijos si la tengan hoy en día.
texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years of age and managed to study to the 7th grade. Now, she is married and her husband is a farmer. The couple have had two children, ages 10 and 7, both of whom attend school at the community educational center.

Gloria is a housewife, and for that reason, she performs domestic chores. But she also sells very popular and recognized products from catalogs. Among these are perfumes and items of clothing. In this manner, she helps her husband cover the expenses of his agricultural work.

Gloria is requesting this loan to finish covering the costs of the agricultural work, while the remainder of the loan will be used to make necessary home improvements.

Gloria's dream is to continue working very hard alongside her husband, and she dreams of seeing her children grow up with a good education, an opportunity she never had.  Gloria believes it is indispensable that her children should have an education today.

loans.use: to finish covering the costs of their agricultural work, while the rest will be used to make improvements on the family's home.

loans.name: Neftali

texts.es: Don Neftalí es propietario de un comedor y tortillería ubicado en san Martin. En el ofrece a sus clientes y público en general comidas típicas y especiales como lo son: pepián, sub-anik, caldo de rez, guisado, churrascos y demás platillos que son del gusto de sus clientes y de quienes han probado tan deliciosas comidas. Este es el cuarto crédito que solicita. Agradece a Fape Y Kiva el apoyo que brindan para poder ayudarse. Con los créditos ha podido comprar más material para cocinar, y también para arreglar el área de su comedor y por ello han crecido sus ventas y obtenido más ganancias y con eso está dando estudio a sus cinco hijos porque lo que él desea es que sus hijos se lleguen a graduar y así desenvolverse mejor en la vida. Sus pagos los ha hecho muy puntuales. Está bien motivado a trabajar y salir tanto en lo material como en lo espiritual y esta instruyendo a sus hijos en la vida cristiana.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles  para la elaboracion de comida.
texts.en:
Neftalí owns a restaurant/tortillería located in San Martín. He offers traditional foods such as pepián [a meat, vegetable and spice stew], subanik [a beef, pork and chicken vapor-cooked plate made in spiced chili sauce], beef soup, stew, steak and other dishes that his customers like because they are simply delicious.

This is Neftalí’s fourth loan. He wants to thank Fape and Kiva for the support they have given him to get ahead on his own. With the loans, he has bought more ingredients and made some repairs. This has resulted in more sales and better profits to pay for his five children’s education. He wants to see his children graduate and have better opportunities in life.

Neftalí has paid the installments on time. He wants to work and to grow in spiritual and material terms. He is raising his children in the Christian faith. He is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de hortalizas y frutas,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas y hortalizas.La socia solicita el credito pata comprar manzanas,naranjas,papas,zanahorias y uvas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Livia continues to work in the sale of fruits and vegetables.  

Through her work in this business she hopes to provide for her children.  Her dream is to increase her sales of fruits and vegetables.  

She is asking for the loan to purchase apples, oranges, potatoes, carrots and grapes.  She is happy about the loan and she promises to complete the payments of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase apples, oranges, potatoes, carrots and grapes.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es:
José tiene 48 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 6° grado, hace tiempo se separó de su pareja y con él vive una hija y su yerno. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, pero además es carpintero ya que lo aprendió de su padre desde que tenía 15 años y piensa que es un arte poder elaborar productos de madera.

José está escaso de herramientas de trabajo es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas para su carpintería y el resto lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes para los cultivos que está por sembrar. 

Él piensa que la vida sin sueños y sin metas, no es vida, es por eso que sueña con tener una carpintería más grande y si es posible llegar a distribuir a grandes comerciales.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old.  He studied until the sixth grade.  He separated from his wife many years ago and he lives with a daughter and his son in law.  

He has worked in agriculture for many years, but he is also a carpenter, which he learned from his father at the age of fifteen.  He thinks it is an art to be able to create products out of wood. 

José is low on tools and for this reason he is asking for the loan to purchase tools for his carpentry.  The remainder will be used to purchase fertilizer for the crops that he is about to plant.

He thinks that life without dreams and goals isn't a life. That is why he dreams of having a bigger carpentry business and, if possible, distribute to larger stores.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his carpentry.  The remainder will be used to purchase fertilizer for the crops that he is about to plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the standard of his cafe for his customers by painting the cafe, buying new cutlery and cafe clothes

loans.name: Mutumia Mwireri Group

texts.en:
The lady holding a passbook with her two raised hands is Hannah; a member of Mutumia mwireri Group. She joined Hand in hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 to benefit from training, especially on enterprise development.  Hannah is 29 years old and a mother of three children, who are all attending school.

Her economic activities are vegetable and dairy farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy dairy feed and fertilizer to increase production of vegetables and milk in order to earn more income to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed and fertilizers to increase production of vegetables and milk hence earn more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with one child.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Da None Chaung Village - Group 1

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Da None Chaung group-1, named (from left to right) Thein O, Thein, Maung, Ye and Aung. 

The Featured Borrower, Aung, has a 10 acre farm in the delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, his income is very low before harvest season.  The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs to harvest his crops.  Aung is 30 years old, and supporting his parents by continuing their rice farming business.  Aung and his family hope eventually to be able to save enough money to buy farming equipment, such as a water pump.

The fund will help a total of 30 borrowers in the village. The CBO leaders oversee this group, and they will purchase farming essentials and labor needed for harvest time with this loan.  Da None Chaung Village group 1’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal foods. They also raise livestock such as ducks and pigs, for additional income.

loans.use: To buy crop seeds and fertilizers, rent farm equipment and purchase petrol for farm equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She has a photography and money transfer shop for two years and she sells cosmetics and perfumes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Houda is a hard worker and ambitious lady, who has a good reputation in her region. She is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly requested products to satisfy her customers' needs.

Houda hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with newly requested products to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is a 54-year-old widowed mother of an adult child and she lives with him and her old mother in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. 

She has worked as a cleaner in a factory since 2010, earning USD4 each day. Her son is 23 years old and he works as a construction worker, making approximately USD6 a day. 

Pov would like to improve her family finances, therefore she has decided to secure a loan to buy a cow to breed for calves to sell. For more plans, Pov wants to build a new kitchen for the family use.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 39 year-old married mother of five. Thirteen years ago she started managing her grocery shop in an attempt to help her husband in satisfying their family's increasing needs. Ghada is a hard worker and sacrificing mother, who is raising her children and managing her shop tirelessly. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through opening a vegetable and fruit section and she wants to buy a refrigerator to store her products.
Ghada hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to open a vegetable and fruit section and buy a refrigerator to store her products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of assorted cereals for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, salt, and soap for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his milling machine.

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail is 39 years old and married with one child.

Abegail works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Abegail has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell coconut wine.

Abegail aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Manit

texts.en:
Manit is a 36-year-old married construction worker with three children, who resides in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. He has worked as a construction worker since 2005. His wife is a 35-year-old factory worker. Manit and his wife can make around $15 per day.

He has decided to take out a loan because he needs money to buy more cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan, he will be able to improve the family’s finances. His future plans are to save money to renovate his house and to support his children to finish high school

loans.use: to buy more cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru: Сафармо 59 лет. Она замужем мать одного сына. У нее один единственный. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Сафармо вместе семьей живет в районе Восеъ. Она уже более 18 лет занимается растениеводством. Это деятельность является семейным, потому, что муж и невестка тоже занимается этой видом деятельности. Сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сафармо берет кредит для купли минеральных удобрений, чтобы обработать урожай с минеральными удобрениями и собрать качественный урожай. Сафармо надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Safarmo is 59 years old. She is married and the mother of a son. He is her only son, and is married and the father of two children. Safarmo and her family live in the Vose region. She has worked with field crop cultivation for more than 18 years. This is a family business as her husband and daughter-in-law also work with this. Her son is in the Russian Federation as a migrant worker. 

Safarmo takes a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers in order to process the crop and get a high quality harvest. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers to get a high quality harvest

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 26-year-old single Lebanese woman living with her parents and seven siblings. Five of them are still attending school. In order to help her father financially, she has operated a grocery store since 2007. She is a very hard worker and does not tire of work with the aim to develop her business and to benefit from it. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow funds from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy new merchandise for her business. This will increase productivity and enhance her income. Hanaa insists that she will be a permanent customer to be able to continually develop her business.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her business

loans.name: Momen

texts.en:
Momen is a 26-year-old married man from Gaza City. He lives with his wife in a very simple house. Momen works as an employee in the public sector where he receives a low income. He also has another business, which is a barn for raising sheep. It is a good business and provides him with a good income.

Momen took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy feed and medicine for his barn animals. This will improve the barn environment and increase productivity. 

Momen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for his barn animals.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is a 42-year-old married woman with five children and is from Talibon, Bohol. Three of her children are still attending school. Her husband is a carpenter.
In addition to that, she  also engages in tobacco vending. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy more stocks of tobacco, an additional pig and pig feed. These are very important tools in augmenting her daily income. They will enable her to cater to her customers' needs and to settle her obligation. She will now be able to prepare healthy food and provide better living conditions.

In the future, Josefa would like to send all of her children to college for an education.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tobacco, an additional pig and pig feed

loans.name: Sahira

texts.en: Sahira is a 58-year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband. She has provided him with extra financial support due to her work in the agriculture sector since 2012. Today, Sahira is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l.  She will utilize the loan to purchase new merchandise for her project, such as seeds and seedlings for plantings. She said that the loan will help her to improve her productivity, and therefore her income.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise such as seeds and seedlings for plantings.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 52 years, married to Deborah and they are blessed with three children. He has been growing napier grass to sell to other dairy farmers and has been in this business for the last 10 years.

He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow more cash crops such as maize, beans and vegetables and make more income to support his family. He will use the generated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes are to grow his farming business, make more profits and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to grow more cash crops and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to sell the milk in her business.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo earns a living through a food-vending business. He sells meat barbecue to the locals in his community. He is 39-year-old father of two children, ages 10 and 5. He has been engaged in food vending for 10 years now. 

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for food vending like meat, seasonings and bamboo skewers. These purchases would help Leo improved his livelihood because he could prepare a variety of barbecue items to sell. That would enable him to augment his income and balance his finances.

In the future, Leo would like to expand his business for the welfare of his growing children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food vending

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amelia is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Amelia has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Amelia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Amelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn works hard to support her family. Merlyn is 28 years old and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Merlyn has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.  Anita is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other maintenance for her business for her bicycle transport business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other maintenance for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize grains for making popcorn to sell.

loans.name: Cecila

texts.en:
Cecila is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. 

She is married and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, oil and eggs. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $500.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, oil and eggs

loans.name: Tafuta Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand on the photograph is Anne. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the training, especially on savings mobilization and enterprise development. She is 41 years old, widowed and blessed with six children. 

Anne is a vegetable farmer and also sells second hand clothes. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more clothes to add as stock to her second clothes selling business, hence to earn more income.  This will eventually enable her to cater for her children's basic needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.
