loans.use: To buy more clothes to add stock to her second hand clothes selling business, hence to earn more income to enable her cater for her children's basic needs.

loans.name: Songtaaba Emmanuel Group

texts.fr:
Mr EMMANUEL est responsable du groupe SONGTAABA EMMANUEL. Marié, il est père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. Tous vont à l’école. Il a 04personnes en charge.
Mr vend des boissons depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans une cave dans un village environnant.
Il veut s’acheter 20caisses de boissons (bière et sucrerie).
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne bien s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is the leader of the Songtaaba Emmanuel Group. He is a married father to two children. His eldest is 10 years old and his youngest is seven. Both of them are currently receiving an education. Emmanuel has four people living under his care.

Emmanuel has been selling beverages for the past 10 years. He gets his supplies from a neighbouring village.

He wishes to purchase 20 crates of beverages (beer and soft drinks).

Emmanuel wants to reinvest the profits back into his business. His goal is to be able to look after his family well.

loans.use: to purchase 20 crates of beverages (beer and soft drinks)

loans.name: Khuram

texts.en:
Khuram, 27, has been running a school for 5 years. As a student, he realized the importance of a good education in a child's life and decided to contribute to this cause when he finished his own education. 

Khuram remembers the obstacles he had to face to build his school's reputation amidst tough competition from other schools in the area. However, he was determined and worked hard to bring his school to the level it is at today. 

Today, Khuram is proud to have almost 150 students in his school, over half of which are girls. He requires a loan of PKR 110,000 to buy chairs and desks for his students and to repair the school building in order to improve the school environment.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for his students and to make repairs to the school building.

loans.name: Sougrenoma Boukare Group

texts.fr:
Mr BOUKARE est responsable du groupe SOUGRENOMA BOUKARE. Marié, il est père de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. Tous vont à l’école. Il a 04personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans un barrage de son village.
Il veut s’acheter 05sacs d’engrais.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour scolariser ses enfants dans de grande école. Il ambitionne acheter une moto pour  sa femme.
texts.en:
Boukare is the leader of the Sougrenoma Boukare Group. He is a married father to three children. His eldest is 15 years old and his youngest is seven. All of his children are currently receiving an education. Boukare has four people living under his care.

Boukare has been a market gardener for the past 10 years. He gets his supplies from his own village.

He wishes to purchase five sacks of fertiliser.

Boukare wants to put these profits towards giving his children a good education. His goal is to buy a motorbike for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of fertiliser

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is taking a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk business which helps her generate income for her family. 

Juliana will use the loan to buy inventory to stock her store such as rice, candles, biscuits, and cigarettes. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00.  

Juliana is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, candles, biscuits, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 29 years old, married and lives in village Salominao. He has wife are engaged in chicken breeding and in cultivating a plot of family-owned land where they harvest nuts. Teimuraz gets a small income from selling nuts and eggs locally. He wants to expand the agribusiness and start beekeeping to produce honey and sell it in a good price. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Teimuraz requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products. They are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income.
This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will increase the family's income and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To start beekeeping to generate additional income

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jane. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has undergone training in enterprise development and financial management. She is 57 years old, married, and has four children.

Jane practices vegetable farming. She has applied for a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to improve her vegetable farming. She hopes this loan will help her get more produce and meet her customers' demands and, hence, get additional income. This will help her improve her standard of living, through things like quality food and better housing.

Jane is very happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support and she promises to promptly repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mixed goods, e.g., sweets, tomato paste, toothbrushes and toothpaste, to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of salt and sugar to sell to customers

loans.name: Weam

texts.en:
Weam is a 48-year-old married woman from a village near Hebron city. She lives with her husband and seven sons and daughters in a very simple house. Weam and her sons raise sheep in a barn near their house. It is a good business and provides them with a good income.
Weam took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for the family business. 
Weam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more sheep for the family business.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.en: Khayriniso is 57 years old and lives with her family in the city of Kulob. Khayriniso has two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a cook in a restaurant. Her daughters are married and sons sell clothes in the local market of their city. Khayriniso has her own business. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years. Khayriniso likes her work because she can provide her family with dairy products. The purpose of this loan is for Khayriniso to increase the quantity of her livestock. Khayriniso awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of her livestock

loans.name: Sayyora

texts.en:
Sayyora is 28 years old. She lives with her parents and three children in the city of Kulob. Her parents are pensioners and the children are minors.

Sayyora has a secondary school education. She sews women's national dresses. Sayyora works very hard, because she should provide for her children and elderly parents. 

The purpose of getting a loan is that she would like to expand her activity. For this she needs to purchase a new sewing machine. Her own sewing machine is old and she cannot work fast. Sayyora really needs for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and expand her business

loans.name: Naftal

texts.en:
Naftal is 46 years old, married and blessed with 1 child. He has a barber shop and has run the business for 15 years.

He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase shavers, hair shampoo towels and mirrors and be able to serve more customers as well as make more income to support his family.

His future hopes are to open another barber shop and make more income.

loans.use: To purchase shavers, hair shampoo, towels and mirrors and be able to serve more customers as well as make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an engine for his R18 taxi.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 46 years old, married, and is blessed with children. He has a retail shop which he has been running for the last 20 years.

He will be using the loan to purchase more stock of maize flour, baking flour, sugar, and rice to sell. He hopes this will enable him to increase his income and provide for the needs of his family.

He plans to use generated profits to educate his children. His future hopes are to expand his retail shop, make more income, and be able to educate his children to higher levels of study.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of maize flour, baking flour, sugar, and rice to sell; he hopes this will enable him to increase his income and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, who appears in this photo, is a 31-year-old married woman from a village near Ramallah City. She lives with her husband and one son in a very simple house. Nida and her family work in raising sheep in a barn near to their house. It is a good business and provide them with a good income.

Nida has requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for the family barn, which will improve the barn and increase its productivity.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for the family barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production and use cow dung from it to prepare composite manure so as to improve her farming activity.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 30 years old, married, and is blessed with two children. He is a farmer and the business has been profitable. He grows Napier grass, maize, beans and vegetables to sell.

Michael will use this loan to buy a dairy cow and hopes this will enable him to get more milk to supply to his customers. He will use the generated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes are to add more dairy cows and supply more milk for sale.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow; he hopes this will enable him to get more milk to supply to his customers and make more income to educate his children.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 67 years old, married and supports a family of 4 members. He has been operating as a small scale farmer for the last 25 years and earns KES 10,000 per month.

John has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to practice dairy farming to increase his income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his farming and to educate his children.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to practice dairy farming to increase his income.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Purificacion is 56 years old, married, and has five children. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. 

Purificacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Purificacion has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia works hard to support her family. Nemesia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years now.

Nemesia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Nemesia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha is 47 years old and has one child in school.

Editha has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 41 years old and married with three children.

Esperanza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, condiments, personal product care and other groceries.

Esperanza has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Esperanza, aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, condiments, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 38 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Estelita works very hard to provide for them.

Estelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, personal product care and other groceries.

Estelita has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Estelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a raising pig business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Rose is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a 43-year-old married father of eight children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a hard-working man who has used a previous loan to increase his income. He has managed to support his family using the proceeds from his retail business and hopes to increase his stock and start trading wholesale. He will use this loan to buy more stock like cooking oil, salt, bread and other items for his business to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like cooking oil, salt, bread and other items for his business to sell.

loans.name: Kawempe Mbogo School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jamiru. He is the Head teacher of Kawempe Mbogo Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kawempe in Kampala with 870 students. Kawempe Mbogo Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kawempe Mbogo Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jamiru ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tegawende Saidou Group

texts.fr:
Mr SAIDOU est responsable du groupe TEGAWENDE SAIDOU. Marié, il est père de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Mr fait l’élevage depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans un village environnant.
Il veut s’acheter 07 moutons.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans l’activité. Il ambitionne bien s’occuper de  sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. SAIDOU is the head of the TEGAWENDE SAIDOU group. He is married with five children aged 8 to 20, three of them in school. 

Mr. Saidou has been a breeder for 10 years. He buys animals in a nearby village. He plans to buy 7 sheep. 

He will use his profits to reinvest in his activity. His goal is to take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 7 sheep.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old divorced woman from the village of Sakobo. She lives alone and has small agricultural activity cultivating cereals. Her income is seasonal and that's why Mariam decided to start a stable activity.  

Mariam lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting this business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo will enable her to get a loan of 3000 GEL and to open a traditional Georgian bakery. She will purchase equipment and working materials and start baking traditional Georgian bread. Mariam thinks that this business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the bakery is opened, Mariam will have a stable income which enables her to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future. 

With the support of the Start Up program, Mariam will have an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a traditional Georgian bakery to stabilize her main source of income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell at retail.

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en:
Haykush is a cook working at a local school. She lives in the town of Yeghegnadzor with her husband and son.

After her work in the school, Haykush and her husband take care of their family farm. They are specialized in beekeeping and have 26 beehives in their farm. The high-quality honey which Haykush gets in her farm, her family sells in the local markets.

Haykush is excited to develop her beekeeping business, so she will be able to get more honey and gather more income for the family's living. This loan will allow Haykush to purchase 20 hives, 9 bees and pesticides for beehives. As this is Haykush's first loan, it has will be approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Haykush get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. 

Haykush hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 20 hives, 9 bees and pesticides for beehives to develop her beekeeping business and make it profitable

loans.name: Ayleene

texts.en:
Ayleene is a loving and devoted single mother, who works long hours to make ends meet. Ayleene has spent years helping others through her work with various non-profits and community organizations, but lack of funding for Ayleene’s department at her former job left her unemployed for nearly a year. This was a major setback in Ayleene’s life that caused severe damage to her credit as she did not have the funds to care for family and to pay her bills. Ayleene has since found stable work with an organization that has been established for several years and is known for providing education and counselling for young women. She has since settled her financial obligations however, the damage to her credit has hindered her ability to access financing to make much needed repairs to her home. Ayleene needs to replace her air conditioner due to its inefficiency in cooling her home and the extremely high energy costs associated with running the old unit. Summer is fast approaching and she cannot afford to pay for her air conditioner out of pocket, so she turned to SELF in hopes that she will be able to access affordable financing that will also help her rebuild her credit. This repair will not only save Ayleene money, but will also help her rebuild her financial strength while providing enhanced livability in her home for herself and her child.

Ayleene will use her KIVA loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner that will help her save money on energy bills, reduce her carbon footprint, rebuild her credit and improve the livability in her home for herself and her child.

loans.use: a new high efficiency air conditioner that will help her save money on energy bills, reduce her carbon footprint, rebuild her credit and improve the livability in her home for herself and her child.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, a 32-year-old married mother of two children, works hard in two jobs to support her husband who is employed in construction but earning a limited monthly income. She works in a pharmacy earning a limited monthly income, so to improve her family's living conditions she started her own business selling perfume in 2010. 

Hanan has requested this loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car needed to facilitate her transportation from one job to another. She hopes to develop her own business more in the future so that she can work from a fixed location.

loans.use: To buy a car for her business

loans.name: Girasol De Monimbó Group

texts.es: Conformado por 4 mujeres, el grupo “Girasol de Monimbó”, solicita su segundo crédito para poder engrandecer sus negocios, demostrando ser mujeres responsables y cumplidas. Rosa Argentina, de 40 años, casada. Tiene su negocio de venta de gaseosas y helados, este negocio lo inicio con su esposo y con los ingresos de él. Requiere del préstamo para compra de más gaseosas de tamaño retornables, 12onz y de 3 litros. Su meta es crecer como empresaria. Sus integrantes son Candida de 37 años, su negocio es de venta ropa nueva para su variedad de clientela; Josefa de 36 años se dedica a  la venta de calzado, Rosa Argentina, de 53 años todo un ejemplo de superación. Su negocio es de hechura y venta de billeteras de mujer.
texts.en: Made up of four women, the Girasol de Monimbó Group is requesting its second loan so they can expand their businesses, as they have proven to be responsible and reliable women.  Rosa Argentina is 40 and married.  She has a business selling soft drinks and ice cream; she started this business with her husband and with his income.  She needs this loan to buy more recyclable-size soft drinks, 12oz and 3 liters.  Her goal is to grow as a businesswoman. The members are Candida, 37, whose business is selling new clothing for a variety of clientele; Josefa, 36, who sells shoes for a living; Rosa Argentina, 53, a shining example of self-improvement.  Her business is making and selling women's wallets.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable-size soft drinks, 12oz and 3 liters.

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en:
Hilal is a 26-year-old single man who has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2008 to make his living.

He used to sell his products through a pickup truck he has, which he used to travel to nearby villages to sell his products, but eventually decided to settle down.

Today, Hilal is working on developing his business and expanding his working place, and so for this reason he is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with special spring and summer production, in addition to renting his next door shop to expand his working place and increase his business capital overall.

He hopes that he can start a wholesale trade and cover a wider region in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with spring and summer production, in addition to renting his next door shop to expand his working place and increase his business capital

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en: Rath is a 43-year-old married mother living in Santok district of Kampong Thom province. She has seven children, four of whom are dependent on her. For a living, she grows rice as the main source of income. She has been involved in her job for more than ten years.This is Rath’s third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. In a group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes that she can provide family members with a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is a woman from Mcarthur, Leyte.  In order to earn her living, she raises and sells hogs. She is 24 years old with a 3-year-old daughter. She has been raising hogs for 5 years now.  She faces financial problems to continue supporting her hog raising livelihood.

Jessa has requested a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to buy pig feed and supplements. These materials are essential improving her hog raising business, which would allow her to sell quality hogs and enable her to prepare a healthy diet for her family. 

Jessa is hopes that she can manage her resources properly to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplements.

loans.name: Hedinah

texts.en:
Hedinah is a 24 years old and she supports 6 family members. 
She has been a dairy farmer for the last 2 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 11,000. 
She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to purchase a cow for milk production to meet the demand of her customers and the needs of her family. 
She plans to use increased profit to repay the loan and expand her agricultural produce. 
Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production to meet the demand of her customers and the needs of her family.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 50-year-old married mother of five children who has been working as a tutor for thirteen years to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a sacrificing mother who is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions despite her low income. 

Today, Sawsan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary home appliances which she needs to satisfy her family. 

Sawsan hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and to help her husband in opening a dessert shop.

loans.use: to buy necessary home appliances

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina lives in Gargar village of Lori region alone. Her only son is married and lives with his family separately. After her husband passed away, Valentina had to take care of their farm alone. Despite a number of difficulties, Valentina was able to  sustain her farm and currently keeps six cows, calves and two piglets. Near her house, Valentina also grows potatoes. 

This loan will enable Valentina to purchase three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Valentina get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. 

Valentina hopes to receive lenders' support and develop her farm.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has a piece of agricultural land in Marapong, Sibutad. She grows pineapple and peanut and earns well for her family. 

She is thankful that Paglaum MPC has been her constant financing partner for her farming activities. Now, she applied for a loan to pay for fertilizer and compost. Erlinda hopes to have a good yield so that she can save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 50-year-old married woman with four dependents. Her youngest child is 16 year old.

She engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish to the locals in her place. She has been engaged in fishing for a quite a number of years now. Aside from fishing, she also raises hogs to have supplemental income.

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, fish feed and pig feed. This loan will augment her ongoing catch and improve the way she raises her hogs as well. In this way, her earnings will go higher and start to handle her finances. She could now continue to send her children to school and be able to provide the basic necessities.

Elizabeth will do her best to expand both her sources of income to become more sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fish feed and pig feed

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 55-year-old married mother of five children, who started in 2008 her own Mouneh (traditional pickles) production and sales business to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs and developing their living.  Zahra is well known in her region with her special talents in her domain and encouraging prices she sets.

Her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will represent her fifth loan cycle where she proved to be a good standing borrower with a good paying back history. Her previous loans helped her a lot in developing her family's living, and business. 

Today, her current acquired loan will be invested in buying necessary raw materials and oils to increase her Mouneh production and sales.
She hopes that one day she can move her business outside her house and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials and oils to increase her Mouneh production and Sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers, baking powder, cigarettes, soaps, biscuits and plastic sheets to sell to customers.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 58 years old, married and residing at Libertad, Sapang Dalaga in the Philippines. To make a living, she buys and sells assorted products. 

She joined PMPC on January 2010 in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative. Recently, she's accessing another loan in the amount of PHP 14,900 as additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of assorted products to sell in the local community. She is focusing on selling vegetables and fruits for her expansion.

loans.use: to buy assorted products: vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Grigoli

texts.en:
Grigoli is a 60-year-old single man, from the village of Sartichala. He lives alone and the only source of income for him is transfers from abroad. Grigoli finds it hard to have financial stability and has great desire to be involved in his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. 

After several unsuccessful attempts, Grigoli applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Grigoli decided to purchase a second-hand car and start serving local people as a taxi driver. He will work on private orders and become financially independent. 

Grigoli will be very grateful for the financial support, as he will be involved in his own business and make a better style of life. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To generate his own income and start a taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace, 36 years old, is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She has been in the transport business for five years having used the previous loan to pay for a motorcycle. She also practices farming, growing vegetables and fruits on top of her salary, as other sources of additional income. 
Peace started her business to get income for her family.

Peace has requested a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and bricks to fulfill her dream of building a strong house for her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and bricks for her house

loans.name: Arkan

texts.en:
Arkan, age 38, runs a grocery store business to earn an income. He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2003. He has built up good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area. He has an excellent reputation.

 Arkan is married and has two children. He works hard to provide his family's income all by himself. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $3,000, which he will use to buy a fridge and a generator. He also wants to install signage for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and a generator and install signage

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia  is a 33-year-old, married woman. She is been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 36 years old and married. She lives in Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past 10 years, Mary Ann and her husband have been farmers, focusing on planting rice, corn, vegetables and root crops. This is how they earn a living. Mary Ann earns 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. As a new member of PMPC, Mary Ann is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase 8 bags of fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and to be able to engage in agricultural business ventures.

loans.use: to purchase 8 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida  is 40 years old, a married woman. She has been in business in her beauty parlor for many years. She offers many options to her customers such as make-up, hair styling, and facials.  Over the time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

Shahida needs to be able to serve more customers time after time. That is why she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to purchase combs, hair straightener, make-up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time to earn more revenue for running her household activities efficiently.  

Shahida is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, make-up kits, and cleansers to treat many customers at a time and earn more revenue for running her household activities efficiently.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is a farmer and has been raising cows for the past several years. Together with her occupation in agriculture, Anzhela also works at a local kindergarten. Her husband is retired and provided with a pension, and their son works in the private sector.

Anzhela chose the cattle breeding business, because it is profitable: dairy products are in high demand. This loan will help Anzhela to purchase two cows needed to develop her livestock breeding business.
 
This is her second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions before, was very difficult to pay back, and Anzhela faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Anzhela was able to run their agricultural business in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, Anzhela has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for two cows needed to develop her livestock breeding business

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi, her husband and their three year old son live in Noravan village. Varduhi's husband is an army officer, so Varduhi has to take care of their farm alone. She keeps 18 calves there and also cultivates potatoes and grows fruit trees. 

This loan will help Varduhi purchase three calves and forage for feeding the livestock in order to develop her farming business.
 
This is Varduhi's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions before, was very difficult to repay and Varduhi faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she and her husband were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Varduhi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

Varduhi hopes to receive lenders' support and make her farm profitable.

loans.use: to pay for three calves and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rebeca is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rebeca has a buy-and-sell bamboo business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more bamboo to sell.

Rebeca has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 29 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Joy has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Joy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Iiyuni Pepper Growers S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Elizabeth; she is a member of Iiyuni Pepper Growers S.H.G group. 

Elizabeth is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2012 to benefit from the training, especially in savings mobilization,and enterprise development.

Elizabeth practices mixed farming; She has also started a grocery store in the nearby market. She has applied for Kiva loan to buy improved and certified seeds and pay for labor during harrowing, weeding and harvesting of her farm produce.  

This will increase income; hence, she will be able to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy improved and certified seeds and pay for labor during harrowing, weeding and harvesting

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Esther, 37 years old, married and blessed with eight children. She joined Hand in Hand in 2013 and underwent all the training on enterprise management and financial management.

Esther borrowed her first loan which she used to start an enterprise of buying and selling scrap metals. She is borrowing for her second loan from Kiva and plans to start a welding shop. She anticipates the enterprises will grow, thus she will earn more income to meet her family needs.

Esther is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and she promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy stock for her welding shop such as electrodes, wrenches and clamps.

loans.name: Ilaha

texts.en:
Ilaha is 32 years old. She is married, with a 5 year old daughter and lives with her family in the Fuzuli region. The family members are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons). Her mother-in-law helps to take care and educate her child.

Ilaha is in the sales business. In the store, Ilaha sells cleaning and personal products.  To develop her business, she wants to open a food products section. For this reason she needs a loan in the amount of 1600AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

Ilaha says “Thanks dear Kiva lenders for your support. I’m greatly thankful to you.”  Ilaha wants a good future for her child.

loans.use: to open a food products section in her store to increase business.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en:
Layal is a 25-year-old divorced woman who started almost two years ago working as a hairdresser to cover her needs and expenses. Being a divorced young lady didn't affect Layal's ambitions and dreams. She is a hard worker and independent lady who believes that she can build her own future and career without anybody's help.

Today, Layal is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary beauty machines and tools for her salon which will facilitate her work and allow her to satisfy her customers' needs.

Layal hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary beauty machines and tools for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farming activity by applying modern technology to increase production for more income and improve the family living standards.

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en: Nehemiah is 24 years old and married with one child. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a general merchandise shop, a business he started in order to look after his family and earn a living. He has a dream of completing his residential house. However, he is faced with the challenges of limited capital and price fluctuations of retail products. Nehemiah intends to use the loan to buy salt, sugar, millet flour, soft drinks and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, millet flour, soft drinks and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Azubed

texts.en: Azubed is a 33-year-old male, who is married with no children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a shop of general merchandise alongside farming, growing crops such onions, maize, rice and others. He also has a carpentry work shop to get additional income. Azubed  has a dream of expanding his commercial farming business. However, he is faced with challenges of pests and diseases plus poor climatic changes, when customer's turn up and very low sales. Azubed wants money to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is 51 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school.

Lolina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lolina has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en: Rozi is 44 years old and married with 10 children. She lives in Kasese,Uganda. She used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. For 24 years now, she has been selling second hand clothes and alongside practicing farming for additional income. She is determined to educate her children up to university so they become independent. She complains of high transport costs that hinder the progress of her business since she has to move to different markets for trade. Rozi has requested another loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Nyakarongo Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Harriet is the mother of two children, who both go to school.  The family lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

Harriet deals in selling salt, sugar, and soap.  She also farms, farming, growing crops like tea to supplement her income -- a business she started for income generation. 

Harriet intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap, salt, and rice for selling.  She has a dream of building a house for her family, despite the business challenge of defaulters plus price changes. 

She is a member of a village bank where members guarantee one another to get a loan.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, salt, and rice to sell

loans.name: Ngangi Byansi Group

texts.en: Gertrida is a married woman with eight children. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and is a member of a village bank where they guarantee one another to get a loan. She sells fresh foods in different markets in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. She started with capital from savings in their group and group loans. She does not have enough capital to buy fresh foods. Her vision is to have a retail shop to supplement her income. Gertrida is requesting a loan to add more capital to her fresh foods business.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is a client from Iraq. He is 30 years old and married. He has one child. Mahdi is a barber. He established his business in 2005 after gaining good experience while working as barber with a friend. He also obtained a certificate in hair dressing. He is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. Mahdi is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate and decorate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to buy his own car and build a small house.

loans.use: to renovate and decorate the shop.

loans.name: Nyambeho Bakyara Twekambe Group

texts.en: Joveni is an older married woman living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop where she has spent many years. She serves the rural community in her village, which has greatly helped the people. They no longer have to travel long distances for essential goods like salt and soap. She is also a farmer and that is where she gets capital for this business. She faces challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations of her retail products. Joveni has personal goals of educating her children. Joveni is requesting a loan to buy salt, soap, and sugar for resale. She is a member of the group where every member guarantees each other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: To buy salt, soap, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Rashda

texts.en: Rashda is a married woman and a mother of 2 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profit to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales and earn profit to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is a 24-year-old single man who has been selling vegetables and fruits for two years. He carries his vegetables and fruits on the pickup truck and moves between villages driving up bumpy roads until he sells them all.

Taleb is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. Thus today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with more kinds of vegetables and fruits to satisfy his customers' needs.

Taleb hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with more kinds of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, está preparándose para la llegada del invierno y requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar leña y hacer algunas reparaciones en el local que tiene ubicada la tortillería, tendrá parte de la materia prima a su disposición y no dejara de trabajar con los cambios del clima.
La ayuda que le brindaron los inversionistas kiva con el crédito anterior le sirvió para que su negocio estuviera surtido, atendiera mejor a sus clientes, sus ingresos nuevos los ha invertido en mejorar la vivienda y en comprar electrodomésticos.
texts.en: Blanca is preparing for the arrival of winter and needs a new loan to buy wood and make some repairs to the place where her tortilla stand is located. She has part of the raw material she needs on hand and will not stop working with the change in the season. The support that the lenders at KIva gave with the last loan helped her to stock her business and serve her customers better. She invested her new income in making improvements in her house and buying appliances.

loans.use: to buy wood and make some repairs to the location where she has her tortilla stand.

loans.name: Janes

texts.en:
Janes is a 55 year old man from Kisumu.  He is married and supports 7 people in his family. He was blessed with 2 kids, who are 2 and 6 years old respectively.

He operates a motorbike transportation business. He has been doing this for the last 5 years and generates a monthly income of Kes 40000, He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund, which he will use to purchase a new motorbike, so as to be able to support his family and expand his business. He will use the anticipated profit to plow it back into the business.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for his business improvement

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old. She supports a family of three members. 

She has been operating a hotel business for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES 4,500. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to improve her business for more income and to improve her family's living standards. 

She plans to use her profit to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to lead a poverty-free life

loans.use: to improve her business for more income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her farming through application of modern farming technology and increase production for more income.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is aged 37 years. He is married with three children. He operates a retail shop at Nkozi and is requesting a loan $500 to buy stock of food items, beverages and toiletries to boost his business in order for him to meet his customer's needs. The challenge he has is limited capital in his business. With confidence, he says this will soon be history. He is hard working and focused.

loans.use: to buy retail stock to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is aged 29 years. She is single with two children and she is a resident of Nakirebe. She works in the village market and sells all kinds of vegetables. She has a large base of clients but her supplies are still low because of limited capital. She has therefore decided to borrow from UGAFODE so that she can buy in bulk and at a cheaper price which will enable her to increase profit. She usually reinvests her profit and meets household financial oblgations. She is hard working.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is aged 57 years old. She is a mother of 6 children who are all attending school.  She joined Hand in Hand to benefit from the training on savings mobilization and enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming, growing potatoes and cabbages and doing dairy farming. She also has a grocery shop. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds and more fruits and vegetables to increase vegetables production and add stock to her grocery store for increased income.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and more fruits and vegetables to increase vegetable production and add stock to her grocery shop for increased income.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is 60 years old, a widow.  She runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing it and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Munawar has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently.  It will increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently

loans.name: Lumbani Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 30 years old, married, and has five children. She grows Irish potatoes and sells them to people in her community. She started this business in order to pay school fees for her children and to overcome her family’s level of poverty. She has had her business for almost 12 years now. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and pesticides. This will help her to increase her produce. She plans to build a better house for her children and hopes to provide her children with good medical care.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertlizer

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 36-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Nusrat ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Nusrat has requested 45,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 38 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. He has been in the motorcycle transportation for the last 15 years. 

Pius will use the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and repair his motorcycle, so it can be in good condition and serve more customers. He plans to use the generated profits to educate his children and repay the loan.  

His future hopes are to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and repair his motorcycle, so it can be in good condition and serve more customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, who is a 59-year-old married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used her previous loan to buy more salt, paraffin, sweets and other general merchandise to sell. She still runs a general store where she earns a living, though she also owns rentals to earn herself an extra living. She started this business to look after her family. Rose still faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and low demand, while her dream is to diversify her business.

Rose intends to use the loan to buy bread, cakes and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy bread, cakes and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Abed El Zohra

texts.en:
Abed is an Iraqi client aged 67. He is married and has 4 children. He has owned a car spare parts store since 2004. He has built a good experience in this field since he learned it from his father, who had the same type of business. 

Now he became very well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation. Abed is requesting a loan amounting to $2,400 to make some renovations and to install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to improve his business and increase his profits, so that he may be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to make some renovations to his building and to install a rolling shutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy g-nut seeds to plant in 2 hectors of land

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is an Iraqi client aged 46. He is married and has one child. Hassan worked with his brother in the construction business since 2000, so he built vast experience in this field. In 2010 he decided to establish his own business; therefore he opened a store for construction materials and hand tools. He became well known in the surrounding area. He is requesting a loan of $3000 to pay the annual rent and install shelves in the store. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that in the future he will be able to buy a piece of land for each of his children.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and install shelves in his construction supply store.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business in her home since her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Razia  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000. 

With the requested loan, Razia wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on-time, to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 35-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough alone to support his family. Khalida ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities. This will help her to meet the increasing demand of her clients to gain more profit. She dreams of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food, such as maize flour and bananas, to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
This group is called Dufatanye, which means “Solidarity” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses in order to change for a better future. 

Marie Gorette is a group leader. Aged 33, she is married with one child who is five years old and doesn't yet go to school. Marie Gorette sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and maize for reselling. The profits from the business will be used to make savings. She wishes to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and maize for reselling.

loans.name: Abakoranabushake Group

texts.en:
ABAKORANABUSHAKE is a group led by Catheline, who is 36 years old. The group name means “Volunteers” in English. She is married, with three children, aged between 3 and 16 years. She owns a pharmacy and has been doing business for the past 9 years. 

The group members sell different items and they have the same hopes for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more medicines to  sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for sale.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a sixty-one-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been able to look after his family by farming, which is his main source of income. He also earns extra income from his side business of raising goats. He is optimistic about having a big coffee plantation, but he has been limited by weather changes. He is applying for a loan to buy more fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred, who is a thirty-eight-year-old, hardworking, married man, runs a retail shop as his main source of income, alongside a motorcycle transport business. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He was inspired by the need to improve his standard of living. He so much wishes to expand his business in his area and to own a big wholesale shop, but he is challenged by the high rate of inflation. He is applying for a loan to buy more sugar, salt, cartons of water and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, cartons of water and other items to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is produce farming, which he practices alongside motorcycle transport. He was inspired by the flexibility of the business to start it up, since it required little capital. He faces a challenge of price fluctuation. However, he has a family vision of having educated children.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more maize seedlings and manure.

loans.use: to buy more maize seedlings and manure.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred, who used his previous loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm, is a hardworking farmer living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the past 15 years. He also practices the rearing of cows to earn extra income. 

Fred was inspired by the need to educate his children to start up these businesses. He still faces the challenge of seasonal changes and soil exhaustion that needs the constant application of manures. However, he has a vision to become a modernized farmer.

He is requesting for a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Sulaiman is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy a motorcycle for his business, and is still in transport alongside farming. He is facing hardships of low income that hinders his progress. Besides that, he is working very hard to make sure he constructs a good house. He has asked for a loan to help him buy cement and sand, and to pay labor, for the house he is constructing for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay labor, for the house he is constructing.

loans.name: Daviti

texts.en: Daviti, who is 27 year-old married man, lives in Norio village. He has a wife, who is a private tailor and earns her own small income. Daviti is a hired worker at a block factory and receives a fixed salary. In order to improve his family's living conditions and create a better style of life, Daviti wants to start a private business and increase his productivity. He needs financial support to purchase a mini-bus and to have money for working capital so he can trade in fruits and vegetables. Daviti has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans on soft terms to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Daviti, and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life. He awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus and start trading in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is a mother of three sons aged 15, 9 and six years. Together with her husband she has been running a farming business for the past 15 years. Meri and her husband cultivate different types of fruit and vegetables (corn, haricot, potato, onion, garlic, plum, pomegranate, fig and apple) and sell them in the local bazaar. As the products they grow on their farm are in high demand, Meri would like to expand her business to cover demand and gather more income for her family. 

She has requested this loan to pay for four cows and the renovation of her agro machine. This will help to handle the harvesting work and gather income for the family's living. This is Meri's second loan. Unfortunately the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to return back, and Meri faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Meri and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Meri has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for four cows and the renovation of her agro machine.

loans.name: St Clare 111 Group

texts.en:
Stella is a 47 year old woman, married with 6 children and a member of St Clare group, living in Kasese Uganda. Stella sells dry agriculture products (produce) such as groundnuts (peanuts), beans, maize, millet and others. 

Stella has a dream of growing her business and educating her children. However, she is faced with the challenge of the price fluctuations of agricultural products. Stella wants money to buy groundnuts, beans, maize, millet and others for selling.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, beans, maize, millet and others for selling.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine, her husband, her mother-in-law and her two children live in Arevabuyr village, in the Ararat region. She has been running an agricultural business for the past several years. Narine owns greenhouses where she cultivates greens, tomato and potatoes. The farm also includes livestock, such as cows, calves, hens, pigs and piglets. Narine’s favorite thing about her business is that it earns her money, and what make her proud is that it enables her to take care of her children. With this loan, Narine wants to purchase a cow, a pig and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Narine get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Narine hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a pig, and forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Aghavnik

texts.en:
Aghavnik lives with her three children and husband in Achajour village of Tavush region. Her family's main occupation is a farming business. Because the farm is big, everyone in the family is involved in the working process. Aghavnik's elder daughter is also a teacher in local village school.
 
The family's farm includes livestock of 18 cows, 20 calves, 6 sheep, 7 pigs and 10 hens. Aghavnik and her second daughter also organize cultivation of wheat, potato and several fruit trees (plum, pear, apple and nut) near their house.
 
The requested loan is very important for this family to develop their agribusiness. Aghavnik asks lenders to support her so that she can purchase three cows and a calf and so she will have an opportunity to get more products and sell in the bazaar.
 
As this is Aghavnik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Aghavnik get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for three cows and a calf.

loans.name: Divine Kids School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Beatrice. She is the head teacher of Divine Kids School, a mixed school in the urban area of Gayaza Rd. in Kampala with 180 students.

Divine Kids School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Divine Kids School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Beatrice ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 50-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy more second hand clothes to sell. She still deals in the selling of second hand clothes as her main source of income alongside agriculture. She started this business to earn a living and have a better standard of living. Jane still faces a number of challenges, including price changes, seasonal customers and weather changes that affect her business since it's located outside a building, but she has hopes that in future she will own a wholesale boutique.

She is requesting a loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pauson

texts.en:
Pauson used his previous loan to buy more produce to sell like beans, maize, millet, etc. He is a 48-year-old, hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce alongside farming to earn himself an extra income. He started this business to earn a living. He hopes to construct a permanent house. His main challenge is price fluctuation.  

He is requesting a loan to buy more produce to sell like beans, maize and millet.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell like beans, maize and millet.

loans.name: St. Lawrence School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Atanensio. He is the Head teacher of St. Lawrence Senior Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Ssonde in Namugongo. The school has 1000 students. 

St. Lawrence Senior Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system that will enable it to treat enough clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Lawrence Senior Secondary School will repay their loan from school fees, which they collect each term. Atanensio ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir, a young man from village Khidiskuri, lives with his father, brother and sister-in-law. Zakir was unable to start any stable job as he has only a secondary education. His father and brother are private hired workers and are the breadwinners in the family. Zakir has great desire to contribute to the family's welfare and start his own activity. He requested a loan for starting the business, and after several unsuccessful attempts, he applied to Credo. Credo has a joint initiative with Kiva of a start-up loan program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start their own businesses. Zakir has been approved for a loan of 1,400 USD for purchasing stock of towels to start selling at the local market. This credit will be a great support for Zakir as he will become financially independent and contribute to the family's welfare. 

Zakir is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start trading with towels and get his own income.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a hardworking single lady with 4 children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a business selling motorcycle spare parts and bicycles. Also at the same time she has rentals and cottages that add more income for her. 

She is faced with the challenges of limited capital to keep all her businesses running and to educate her children. Besides that she is working very hard to expand her business to new areas in order to yield more income. Teddy has asked for a loan to buy more spare parts and a bicycle for sale.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts and a bicycle for sale.

loans.name: Amernath

texts.en:
Amernath is 52 years old and lives together with his wife and 2 school-aged children. Rice cultivation is the only source of income for him and his family.

He is an old customer of Seva MFI and has always repaid his loans fully. 

Amernath has a tractor and needs to buy 4 new tires and for this he needs a loan of SRD 7000. With the tractor he can work in his fields and also in other farmers' fields. This will give him extra income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy 4 new tires for his tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings to plant in her gardens and pay for labour.

loans.name: Intwali Group

texts.en:
INTWARI is a group led by Agnes, who is 33 years old. The group name means “Heroes” in English. She is married with five children aged between 1 and 13 years. She owns a bar and has been doing business for the past 7 years. 

The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and soda to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Sabitrie

texts.en:
Sabitrie is a 62 year old single woman with three children. Since 2010, she has taken small loans from Seva MFI for vegetable growing. She has raised her plot behind the house, where she plants different kinds of vegetables. 

Sabitrie's previous loans were always repaid on time. She wants now a loan of SRD 4000 for the marriage expenses of her son.

loans.use: To pay for the marriage expenses of her son.

loans.name: Jose Alizandro

texts.es: Jose de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 15 años, adicional trabaja como jornal, vende sus productos en los alrededores de donde el reside y ya tiene muchos clientes con las ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de semillas, abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía  para empezar con sus siembras y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 43 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and his son. He works in agriculture. He raises corn, beans, and sorghum. He has been doing this work for 15 years. In addition, he works as a day laborer. He sells his products in the areas surrounding his home, and he already has many customers. With the earnings, he manages to pay some of the household expenses. 

Jose is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, compost, insecticides, fertilizers, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph so that he can begin his plantings and thus be able to have better economic income.

loans.use: To buy compost, fertilizers and seeds, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Qorychaska-Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORYCHASKA-CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia Georgina ella es soltera y tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Los socios que estan pegadas con la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the community bank "Qoryschaska-Cusco." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
