The member is Mrs. Sonia Georgina. She is single and she is 39 years old. She has two children. She works preparing different dishes such as baked chicken, soups and  stir-fried steak. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She has been working in this business for 8 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. The member is asking for a loan to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables, and chicken. The members  who have been pasted to the group picture, were actually captured in a separate picture after the meeting because they couldn't be there due to work related reasons. The other members work selling sweets, clothing sales, grocery sales, and bookstore sales. The member is grateful to those who make this dream come true through this medium, and is committed to make her payments in the established term.

loans.use: To buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Live Del Carmen

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Live, tiene 67 años de edad y  está separada,  tiene cuatro hijos mayores e intendentes. Vive en casa propia.
Doña Live se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, toldos, sobre camas, etc. Trabaja de lunes a sábados, se dedica a esta actividad 8 horas diarias, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, de crédito y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace dos años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son sabanas y ropa.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar colchas, sabanas, blusas, ropa interior, etc. Está en el grupo de crédito dos años, le gusta la agilidad de los créditos y los pocos requisitos. Su sueño es tener un carro.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered Ecuador's most important, popular, and visited seaside resort because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It has the first deep-water port in Ecuador and South America.

In this place lives Live. She is 67 years old, is separated, and has four adult children—who work as building caretakers. She lives in her own home.

Live makes a living selling all kinds of clothing, canopies, bedspreads, and the like. She works eight hours a day from Monday to Saturday. She sells her products door to door and upon order, and she offers her merchandise on credit and collects payments every week. She has been following this occupation for the past two years, and her business has been going very well because she has many customers. The products that she sells the most are bed linens and clothing.

She will use this loan to purchase bedspreads, sheets, blouses, underwear, and the like. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for the past two years, and she likes it because of the speed of the loan disbursements and the few prerequisites needed to be granted a loan.

Her dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase bedspreads, sheets, blouses, underwear, and the like.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is 54 years old, married and blessed with five children. He is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for the last 17 years. 

Mark has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow and get more milk to supply to his customers and in the hope this will enable him increase his income, educate his children, and support his family.

His future hopes are to expand his farming business by adding more dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and get more milk to supply to his customers and in the hope this will enable him  increase his income and support his family.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is an individual client aged 40 years.  He is married and has five children and is a permanent resident of Kaggaba village in Nakirebe town,

He is dealing in brick making and trade as his business. 

He is now requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 that he will use to hire labour to make more bricks, in order to meet the demand of his customers and also increase his sales and income. 

His major challenge is weather changes, especially the rains that can destroy the bricks.  He appreciates your support because he believes he will be able to advance with time.

loans.use: To hire labour

loans.name: Zedei Bestabe

texts.en:
Zedei is asking for a second credit to finish the  the construction of her kitchen. 

After working with Ecoblock and being able to build a bathroom and bedroom, Zedei is now ready to undergo a new credit and continue with her home completion. 

She is truly excited to be able to give her family this opportunity and live in a house she can feel proud of. 

Zedei and her husband have no access through credit with any other institution and are hopeful that through Kiva they can continue working on their home.

loans.use: to pay for materials to finish building her kitchen

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is a married woman from the village of Odishi. She lives with her husband and earns a living with small agricultural activity. Mostly during the season, they harvest nuts and sell them locally at a good price.

As the family has only seasonal income, Madona decided to start dairy farming and seek credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions.

The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 GEL for purchasing two milk cows.

After the cows are purchased, the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They will also use the milk products for family feeding.

The loan will be a great support for the family, as they will make a significant source of income in regards to Kiva lenders. Madona and her husband rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her agribusiness and start dairy farming.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in Kaps village in the Shirak region with his wife, mother, grandmother and brother. The family's main occupation is in the farming business.
 
Their farm isn't big, but it is sustainable enough to provide the family with minimum living conditions. The farm includes cows, calves and arable land where wheat and potatoes are cultivated. The potato is cultivated in small amounts and is for family use only. 

To enlarge his farming income, Samvel would like to expand the potato production, so he has applied for this loan. The requested loan will help him to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel to start cultivation. Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. 

Samvel's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

Samvel hopes to receive lenders' support and enlarge his agribusiness, so his family will have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel to start cultivation

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan es un agricultor de 67 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos que alimentar. Juan cultiva diferentes productos en su finca de café como plátanos y árboles maderables bajo los certificados orgánico y comercio justo. Su principal fuente de ingresos financieros es el café. Juan cultiva otros productos para subsistir como ser: el maíz y el frijol, pero sólo lo suficiente para alimentar a su familia.
El café es la principal actividad económica en la región donde vive Juan y deja buenas ganancias a las familias de sus productores.
El necesita un préstamo para replantar su cafetal; Juan tenía aproximadamente 7,8 hectáreas (ha) en su propiedad plantadas con café y se vieron severamente afectados por el hongo de la roya. Este año quiere replantar 1,5 ha y cuando empiecen a generar ingresos (al cabo de 2 años), replantar el resto de su propiedad. Actualmente Juan Solicita un préstamo para comprar plantas de café; pagar a los trabajadores, comprar productos agroquímicos (orgánicos), fertilizantes (orgánicos)y otras plantas (frutales y maderables) para hacer una plantación orgánica de café diversificada. El café lo venderá a la cooperativa COCAFCAL de la que es socio.
Un préstamo ayudaría a Juan a sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos que no cuentan con una madre.
texts.en:
Juan is a 67 year old farmer.  He has four children to feed.  Juan cultivate different products on his coffee farm.  He produces such things as bananas and timber yielding trees that are certified organic and fair trade.  His main source of income is the coffee.  Juan produces other products like corn and beans in order to survive.  However, he only produces enough of these to feed his family.  Coffee is the main business activity in the area where Juan lives.  It gives good profits to the families that produce it.

He needs the loan to replant coffee.  He had 7.8 hectares of coffee on his property that was severely affected by the Hemileia Vastatrix fungus (more commonly known as Roya).  This year he wants to again plant 1.5 hectares.  When they start to generate income (after two years), he will replant the rest of his property with coffee.  

He will use the loan to buy coffee plants, to pay the workers, and to buy agrochemical products (organics), fertilizers (organics), and other plants (fruit and wood) in order to rebuild an organic and diversified coffee farm.  He will sell the coffee to the COCAFCAL cooperative, which he is a member of.

A loan will help Juan get his four motherless children ahead.

loans.use: to buy materials to rebuild his coffee farm, coffee plants, supplies, fertilizers, and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy balls, belts, resistance bands, mats, and bars for Zumba lessons

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 38 years old and she supports six family members. 

She has been a farmer for the last seven years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which she plans to purchase a cow for milk production. This will help her meet the demand of her customers and the needs of her family. 

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand her agricultural produce. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dolores de 33 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 2° grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al cultivo de maíz, sus hijos estudian en la escuela. 

Sus hijos son el mayor impulso para Dolores, por lo cual ella trabaja duro en la agricultura, la actividad la realiza con su esposo desde hace más de 10 años, ellos cultivan y venden la cosecha al por mayor, además, su esposo trabaja como albañil en sus días libres.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca aprovechando que viene la temporada en la que hay pasto y así podrá alimentarla.

Como toda madre que busca lo mejor para sus hijos, Dolores sueña que ellos sean profesionales, que tengan una carrera universitaria y además espera aumentar las ventas de maíz.
texts.en:
Dolores is 33 years old, she was only able to study until second grade. Dolores has a partner who makes a living cultivating corn, their children study at school. 

Dolore's greatest motivation is her children, she works hard for them in agriculture, she has been doing this work with her husband for more than ten years. Dolores and her husband cultivate crops and sell them wholesale, her husband also works as a bricklayer on his days off. 

Dolores needs this loan to buy a cow and take advantage of the season coming up when there is grass so that the cow can feed. 

Like any mother who wants the best for her children, Dolores dreams of them becoming professionals and studying at university. She also hopes for their corn sales to increase.

loans.use: to buy a cow and take advantage of the season coming up when there is grass so that the cow can feed.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Florida works hard to support her family.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Florida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her internet café business.

Florida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet café

loans.name: Deonarain

texts.en:
Deonarain is single and 46 years old. He cultivates rice on a land area of 8 hectares. 

Rice cultivation is the only source of income for him. 

He is a regular customer of Seva MFI and always repaid his debts on time. 

Deonarain wants to overhaul his tractor and pick-up truck, so he can work more efficiently and earn more. For this, he needs a loan of SRD 7000.

loans.use: To overhaul his tractor and pick-up truck

loans.name: Darline School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda!  This is Annet. She is the Head teacher of Darline School, a mixed school with 130 students, in the urban area of Wakiso. Darline School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. 

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system, with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Darline School will repay the loan from their school fees, which they collect each term.  Annet ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as to increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ma Leonor

texts.en: Ma. Leonor is 44 years old and a single mother. Since she was young she liked to make some crafts so she took advantage of her natural skills to make a profit of it. Six months ago she started a business selling crafts (crochet, needlepoint, jewelry, ornaments) in the front door of her home in Guanajuato, where art is highly valued by tourists and local people. She plans to open a boutique where she can stock her products and also offer other accessories as handbags, clothes, scarfs and hats increasing sales. She is requesting a loan of MXN 7,000 to buy materials and pay to someone who helps her to do crafts so she can increase the production. Her responsibility is what had helped her to be successful. Her dream is to have financial stability to cover her daughter's college expenses. This is Ma. Leonor’s first loan with Konfío and she is very committed to make a successful repayment.

loans.use: to buy materials needed and pay to someone who helps her.

loans.name: Ma. Antonia

texts.en:
Ma. Antonia is 52 years old and divorced. She is a committed woman who cares about the welfare of everyone and for that reason she became a nurse. Ma. Antonia works in a small clinic and she also treats patients of all ages at her own home. 
Ma. Antonia would like a loan of MXN 5,000 to buy pharmaceutical products and healing material such as alcohol, cotton and bandages. Her dream is to have financial stability in order to own a clinic. Ma. Antonia would like to improve her professional preparation by taking a tanatology course during the coming months. As an independent woman, she is always looking to find out how to move forward in order to provide the best to her son and helps as much as she can to see a happier world. 
Ma. Antonia says it is very rewarding feeling to help people when they need it; they are always  very grateful to her, as she will be if lenders support her to be able to continue doing that humanitarian work.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products and healing material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more boxes of batteries, sweets, and biscuits to sell to customers

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is 54 years old. He is married, but his wife is an itinerant saleswoman. Orlando is a poor man; he is living with his parents and he is the father of a little girl. 

Orlando works as an industrial mechanics teacher, and he needs a loan to fix the rooftop at his parents house because is damaged and his parents don't have money because they are retired and their pensions are low. 

Orlando needs your help. This a good investment for him because the house will belong to him in the future. He hopes you can help him (as you can see in the picture the house is old and it will need more repairments in the future).

loans.use: to fix the rooftop at his parents house

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a businesswoman from Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga. She is 66 years old, married and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that is adequate enough to support her family. Flora is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Flora continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to successfully face all the challenges with courage for her family..

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for sari-sari store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Nancy dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, maize flour, cassava flour, and match boxes to sell.

loans.name: Fabián

texts.en:
Fabian is a farmer that has lived all his in life in San Martin, Puebla. He mainly grows corn and beans in order to make a living. Fabian lives with his girlfriend and their two sons. They know that hard work is what has given them the opportunity for a credit. 

Fabian and his partner have been building their home over the past years little by little. They now wish to properly build the wall that surrounds their property, especially the front part. They say that San Martin is safe, but since they keep all their grain in a barn next to their house, you can never be too safe when it comes to your livelihood. 

Since Fabian has no formal job and no way to prove an income, he has no access to credit from other institutions. He has been saving for some time and only needs a credit to finish the payment for the materials needed.

Fabian is looking forward to providing his family and his work the safety they need.

loans.use: to buy materials to build the wall outside his house

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor is from Byurakn village of Shirak region. He has a big family of five: his parents, brother, sister, and his wife.

Gor's parents are teachers and have been working at a local village school for many years. As Gor and his brother grew up, they started to run their family farm. It includes two cows, calves, 25 sheep, and hens. They also cultivate wheat and barley and sell the gathered harvest in the local bazar.

In the summer season, after cultivation season ends, Gor also travels to a neighbouring country where he is involved in construction work as a migrant worker.

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Gor's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

The loan is very important for this hardworking young man to purchase seeds (barley, corn), fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.use: to pay for seeds (barley, corn), fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase aerated and alcoholic beverages, baby products, and toiletries

loans.name: Micaela

texts.en:
Micaela is married and she pays rent. She is the mother of two daughters; the oldest is 13 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. She loves her family a lot, so she will do anything to give them a better life.

Micaela makes money by selling cosmetics and other beauty products. She needs a loan to buy more perfume. 

Her husband works as an accountant, but his salary is low so he can't help his wife. 

Micaela is healthy and she is responsible; she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy more perfume

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is a businesswoman who earns through buying and selling various items like bags, cosmetics, sandals, etc. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Raquel wants to complete her house. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to completing her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

location.town: Tangub-P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita heads up for the post harvest operations of her palay in Aloran. She wants to prepare well especially the much needed resources for the palay harvesting, threshing, and labor for transport from farm to market road, of which she applied a loan from the Cooperative. Conchita hopes to save enough for future emergencies and business opprtunities.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operation of her palay

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children now at their school age. 
Gemma earns a living from whole copra and coco nuts buy and sell business. She’s been engaged in this business for 5 years already. Nellie earns approximately PHP6,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional pieces of whole coco nuts for resale and copra processing. Gemma has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years already. In the future, Gemma hopes to expand her coco nuts buying and copra processing business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional pieces of whole coco nuts

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is a farmer from Marapong, Sibutad who grows various commodities. She is requesting a loan to pay for fertilizer and compost. Lilibeth hopes to have a good yield so that she can save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita has enthusiasm in managing her farming activities in Aloran. Aside from doing her hobby, she is earning as well. Since she wants to be more productive, Conchita engages in a snack vending business to expand her resources. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from her earnings. Conchita hopesto provide her family with safe and comfortable living quarters, so she requested a loan to purchase marine plywood, nails, plain sheet for house roofing and coconut yard sticks. Conchita is now on her way to repairing her house wishes to earn more from her business to continuously benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, nails, plain sheet for house roofing and coconut yard sticks

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia, 42, lives in Lumbayao, Aloran. She is married and was gifted with four children. Rogelia and her husband are both farmers, they raised their family doing this type of activity. In need of additional working capital,  Rogelia decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 10,000 to pay for labor cost and land preparation to grow her crops and buying of fertilizer and herbicides to get more produce.
Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Rogelia is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost and land preparation to grow her crops and buying of fertilizer and herbicides to get more produce

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en: Mark Anthony was  fortunate for the needed capital when he joined PMPC in 2014. He knew this would be his last opportunity to get back on his feet when went failed after his first business went bad. PMPC to Mark Anthony came as a rescue for lending him money when he needed it badly. Now, he availed another loan for this quarter's cropping. He loaned an amount to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicides to maximize his farm production and able to generate more income. Mark Anthony perseveres and always believe to reach his goals to abundantly provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicides to maximize his farm production and able to generate more income

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 45, married with four children and only three of them attend school. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, beans and rice. He desires to expand and develop his business only to be challenged by unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations that make it hard for him to attain his desires. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Jo-Ann Rose

texts.en:
Jo-Ann Rose is 36 years old and single.

Jo-Ann Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Jo-Ann Rose has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Jo-Ann Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard happily lives in Haykavan village in Shirak region. As Sirvard states, she enjoys her farming and agricultural activities. On her farm, Sirvard keeps three cows, pig and hens. She also cultivates wheat and potato and sells the gathered harvest in the local market. 

Sirvard asks lenders to support her to purchase piglets, potato seeds and fertilizer needed for her farm. Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Sirvard's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for piglets, potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María es una mujer de cincuenta y seis años de edad, con un gran amor por el trabajo, tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas y golosinas. Hace doce años ella inicio con este negocio, buscando salir adelante y mantenerse activa. Su hija es su principal apoyo, ambas inician su jornada laboral desde muy temprano, para tener las tortillas calientes y listas, para los clientes que buscan su producto. 
Actualmente, María es la única persona de su barrio con un negocio de venta de tortillas,  por eso la demanda de su producto ha crecido notablemente, necesita producir más, es por eso que ha solicitado la ayuda de Kiva y MiCrédito, mediante un préstamo que le permita comprar maiz. En sus planes esta poder ofrecer su producto en los mercados de su ciudad, también en un futuro desea comprar un horno para dejar de usar una cocina artesanal.
texts.en:
Maria is a 56 year old woman with a great love for her work. Maria has a business selling tortillas and sweets. She began this business 12 years ago, when she was looking for a way to make money and remain active. 

Maria's daughter is her main support, they both start their working day very early, so that they will have the tortillas hot and ready for their customers.Currently, Maria is the only person in her neighborhood selling tortillas, hence the demand for her tortillas has risen noticeably, and she needs to make more of her products. This is why Maria has asked for help from Kiva and MiCrédito, in the form of a loan which will allow her to buy corn. Maria's plans include selling her products in the city market and in the future she would love to buy an oven so that she can stop cooking via traditional methods.

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is an individual client, aged 55 years, and married with three children. He is an agriculturalist, and besides that business, he also carries out animal rearing, specializing in pigs, and also does alcohol distillation. He started these businesses in 1990. His dream is to have a good home and a bigger coffee shamba (field).

He has applied for the loan to buy good-quality seedlings and some piglets, which will help boost his agricultural yield and income.

Pictured are Isaac and the UGAFODE credit staff in charge of his loan at his coffee shamba.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and piglets to help boost his agriculture business.

loans.name: Ma. Goritte

texts.en: Retailing helped Ma. Goritte earned an income in support to her husband, for their family. She retails various commodities and brings a meager income doing this type of activity. Ma. Goritte plans to expand her retailing business. She applied a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase various commodities and other consumable items for retail. Ma. Goritte smiles at the fact to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase various commodities and other consumable items for retail

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a strong-willed and determined woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Since, she wants to be more productive, Marina engages in meat vending business, where she slaughtered 2 pigs in a week. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal finishing feeds pellets and pay for 10 heads of piglets to grow and sale. Someday, she hopes to open a meatshop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal finishing feeds pellets and pay for 10 heads of piglets to grow and sale

loans.name: Dúo Daniel De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Dúo Daniel de Sumpango Este Dúo esta integrado por Alicia es originaria de Sumpango y madre de familia ella se dedica a bordar tejidos típicos para luego venderlos en las tiendas de ropa que venden por mayor, y lo que ella necesita es comprar hilo para surtir los bordados ya que ha tenido demanda de los tejidos que ella elabora por lo que está solicitando un crédito con kiva para poder Comprar mas materia prima y así mismo tendrá mas ganancia y podrá darles un mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Dúo Daniel de Sumpango Este Dúo group is comprised of Alicia, who is from Sumpango and the mother of a family.

She earns a living embroidering traditional weavings to later sell in the wholesale clothing stores. She needs to buy thread to supply the embroidery, as she has had demand for the weavings that she makes. 

Because of this, she's seeking a Kiva loan to buy more raw material so she will have better earnings and can give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw material for weaving.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is responsible and dedicated in managing her beauty shop. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business, offering services like manicure, pedicure, foot spa, hair treatment services and others. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.
She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and improve her services. She will buy additional set of parlor equipment and supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater more customers.

loans.use: buy additional set of parlor equipment and supplies

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: From Sindangan, Elma is running a beauty parlor to earn a living. She sees to have more available stocks of supplies to be used in her services for her customers. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination. To earn more, she applied a loan to purchase additional sets of foot spa services and equipment for hair treatment. Elma hopes to live comfortably with her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional sets of foot spa services and equipment for hair treatment

loans.name: Jenny Reila

texts.en: Jenny Reila earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services.  She is 21 years old, single and lives with her parents in Sindangan.   Jenny Reila is the eldest daughter, she has four siblings.  Her parents are both farmers. Form her desire to help her family,  Jenny Reila offers house service for manicure and pedicure. She is now well known for the nice quality of services she offers.  She has already purchased some new manicure sets and able to save from it.  Her services is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about Php 4000 per month. This way she can be able to help support her parents for their daily needs. To earn more income, Jenny Reila is seeking a Php  50000 loan.  She would like to use the loan to purchase store inventories to open a sari-sari store business.   This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in few  months.  In her  previous loan she has never had a delinquency.  Jenny Reila is very diligent and wishes to build a descent house for her parents and siblings.

loans.use: to purchase store inventories to open a sari-sari store business

loans.name: Cruzo

texts.en: Cruzo is a "trisikad" (cycle rickshaw) operator for 6 years. He lives in Ozamiz City. His business supports the need of his family. He has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2012. He is requesting  Php 18,000.00 to to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for renovating his house. With the assistance given to Cruzo, he can now live a comfortable house with his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

location.town: Ozamis-P6 Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lila is 50 years old and has three children. She is married, and her three children are in school.

Lila is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for three years.

In the future, Lila would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family’s home.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nora is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nora has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Nora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.en:
Domina is a group leader, aged 56. She is married with four children aged between 16 and 29 years; they all go to school. The group is called “Ubumwe”, which means “Unity” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses for changing their futures for the better.

Domina sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize and beans to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Bonifacio Israel

texts.es:
Bonifacio es un hombre muy trabajador de 35 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato, está felizmente casado y su esposa es ama de casa, tienen solo un hijo de 3 años de edad. 

Bonifacio vive en casa de sus padres junto con dos hermanos más, él tiene 6 años de trabajar en la alcaldía de su comunidad y en sus días libres se dedica a la agricultura, su trabajo le queda a dos km y viaja en motocicleta. 

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales y terminar de construir su propia casa, además pagará mano de obra pues la necesita para llevar a cabo el trabajo.

Como hombre perseverante que es, Bonifacio sueña con tener finalmente su propia casa, pues no hay mayor satisfacción que ser independiente, ofrecerles un hogar a su familia y proveerles siempre lo necesario.
texts.en:
Bonifacio is a very hardworking 35 year old man. He completed high school and is happily married. His wife is a housewife and they have just one child, who is three.

Bonifacio lives in his parents' house with two brothers. He has worked in local government in his community for six years and dedicates himself to agriculture on his free days. His work is two kilometers away and he travels by motorcycle.

This loan will help him buy materials and finish building his own house, as well as pay for labor, which he needs to complete the work.

As a persevering man, Bonifacio dreams of finally having his own home, as there's no greater satisfaction than being independent, offering his family a home and always providing them with what they need.

loans.use: to buy materials and finish building his own house, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Santos Sifredo

texts.es:
Santos de 33 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pues sus padres pensaban que no era necesario, está casado y tiene dos hijas que dependen de él.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura, lo ha realizado desde los 9 años de edad,  esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre y es ahora su medio de trabajo.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes ya que es necesario aplicarlo a sus cultivos.


Él sueña con sembrar tres hectáreas de cultivo para aumentar la producción y que nunca les falte nada a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Santos is 33 years old, he didn't have the opportunity to study because his parents didn't believe it was necessary, he is married and has two daughters that depend on him. 

Santos makes a living from farming, he has been doing it since he was 9 years old. He learnt this work from his father and it is the work he does today. 

Santos needs this loan to buy fertilizer that is needed for the crops. His dream is to plant three hectares worth of crops so that he can increase his production and so that his daughters will never want for anything.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer that is needed for the crops.

loans.name: Ednar

texts.en:
Ednar, who is a 24-year-old man from village Pachkha, has parents and a pensioner grandfather. The family gets income from agricultural activity. Particularly, they own a milking cow and cultivate a plot of agricultural land. Ednar and his parents sell milk products and potatoes at the local open market. This young man has a great desire to be involved in his own business and improve the living conditions for his family. That's why he requested a loan from local financial institutions and after several unsuccessful attempts, his loan request was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Ednar was approved for a loan of 600 GEL to purchase a car and start serving local people as a taxi driver.
 
He is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his family has good living conditions. This loan will be a great support for the family. Ednar is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To renovate his car and start providing taxi service

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol lives in San Martin, Puebla with her husband. She works selling clothes and cosmetics from catalogs. Her husband is a construction worker and together they have saved enough money to little-by-little build her home. Their home is almost complete but it is still missing a floor. Right now the house has only a dirt floor. To Marisol this is really frustrating, since her house is never clean and she can see how this is taking a toll on the family´s health. She says there is an irony in this; it is like the fisherman that starves and the construction worker with no proper house. 

Marisol has no formal job and no proof of income, neither does her husband, so applying for a credit with other institutions is not possible. 

Marisol is asking for this credit to buy the materials needed so her husband could finally build a cement floor for their house. 

She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to build a cement floor for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a proper floor in her house and finish the walls

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta hails in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She raises and sells poultry.  Aside from that, she also engages in the raising and selling of hogs. She is a 41-year-old woman with three dependents, ages 21, 18 and 16 years old. She has been engaged in this kind of business for six years now.

Marietta has requested a loan to buy  feed for pigs and poultry animals. This will help boost her livelihood. 

With this, she could be able to raise healthy hogs. Thus, her earnings will be higher. She could now handle her finances and settle her obligations.

Marietta could now expand her both sources of income to utilize her resources and to be productive and sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and poultry animals

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en:
Thinh, 55, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has five children.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of farmland. She primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural product to local dealers and customers at the market. So far, she has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make earnings of USD 4.00 a day.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling.

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 31 years old, she is a widow with three children.  She has a fishing business and owns fish cages as well. Tessie personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 30,000.00 for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where she will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: purchase of new nets and other fishing accessories

loans.name: Norma Magali

texts.es:
Norma de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja es abogado, ha procreado 3 hijos que asisten a la escuela de la comunidad. 

Norma es empleada en un restaurante de comida a la vista, tiene 2 años en el área de cocina, anteriormente, ella se dedicaba a hacer trabajos escolares a estudiantes y también realizaba los oficios del hogar.

Ella necesita de este crédito para comprar una bomba inhaladora de agua e instalarla en el pozo de su vivienda, pues el agua es algo que no puede faltarle y por eso a ella le urge cubrir esta necesidad.

Ella espera obtener otro crédito más adelante para mejorar su vivienda y que su familia se sienta segura en un hogar con buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Norma is 29 years old. She studied through high school. She is in a relationship, and her partner is a lawyer. She has 3 children, who attend the community school.

Norma is employed at a restaurant that puts food on display. She has been working in the kitchen for 2 years. Previously, she made a living helping students with schoolwork and performing household chores.  

She needs a loan to buy a water pump, which she will instal in the well at her house. Since water is something that she cannot lack, she is pressed to fill this necessity.

She hopes to obtain another loan in the future in order to improve her house so that her family can feel safe in a home that is in good condition.

loans.use: to buy a water pump, which she will instal in the well at her house.

loans.name: Vilma Rosa

texts.es:
A sus cuarenta y cinco años de edad, Vilma, es una mujer que pone todo su esfuerzo en su negocio. Ella tiene una tienda ropa y zapatos, donde también ofrece productos del uso cotidiano para el hogar, por ejemplo jabón, detergente, desodorante, papel higiénico, comida enlatada, frituras, gaseosas, entre otros. Ella inicio en el mundo del comercio, vendiendo ropa y artículos de belleza en una fábrica donde trabajó, ahora ofrece su mercancía desde su casa, donde la ayuda su hijo adolescente después de ir a la escuela.
Ella ha recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito buscando se le beneficia con un préstamo que le permita surtir su pulpería con la compra de sacos de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, entre otros y comprar nueva mercadería de ropa y zapatos. En un futuro desea poder ampliar su tienda, además con sus ganancias poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
At her 45 years of age, Vilma is a woman who puts all of her effort into her business. 

She has a store for clothing and shoes where she also offers products for daily home use like soap, detergent, deodorant, toilet paper, canned food, fried food and soda, among others.

She got started in the business world selling clothes and beauty products in a factory where she worked. Now, she sells merchandise from her home, where her teenage son helps her after going to school.

She's turned to Kiva and Mi Credito hoping to benefit from a loan which will allow her to stock her store with the purchase of rice, beans, and sugar among others, and buy new clothing and shoes for merchandise.

In the future, she'd like to be able to grow her store and improve her house's infrastructure with her income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, beans and sugar, among others, and to buy new clothing and shoes for merchandise.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan lives in Basen village with his wife and daughter. His son serves in the army and his elder daughter is married and lives separately with her family. 

For his family, he has chosen farming and agriculture as his source of earning a living.  His farm includes livestock (cows, sheep, calves and hens) and arable land where a large variety of vegetables and fruit trees are cultivated. 

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Vachagan's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. He needs this loan to purchase barley seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock so his farm will develop and provide higher income.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Chila

texts.en:
Chila is 34 years old, single, and works hard to support her parents.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Chila is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Melchorita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a cafeteria. Melchorita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more used clothes to sell to customers.

Melchorita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra, 46 years old,  is engaged in a retail rice business. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic goods such as noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, beverages, shampoo, seasonings and toiletries. Myra is married and has nine dependents. Six of her children are still attending school.

Myra is asking for a loan to buy additional stock, such as soft drinks, biscuits, beverages and assorted canned goods, for the store. This additional stock will enable Myra's income to improve, allowing her to handle her finances and repay her obligation. She could now continue to support her children's needs, including   healthy meals and better shelter. Myra hopes that she could properly handle both of her sources of income to become sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for the store

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Sopha, 33, is originally from Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of two children. She manages and operates a farming business, growing and selling rice to the local dealers. She has been in this business for around ten years and earns, on average, US $2 a day.

Sopha resides a little bit far from a water source so it is hard and time consuming for her to get water. Due to this reason, she is applying for a KIVA loan to dig a well for household use. With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can get water more easily and in less time than before. Sopha is thankful for the lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 33 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries in making dried fish.

Juliet has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Juliet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries to make dried fish

loans.name: Aghunik

texts.en:
Aghunik, with her husband and four children, lives in Karnut village in the Shirak region. Both Aghunik and her husband work hard to sustain their farming business so their children have the minimum living needs. 

The family's farm includes livestock of cows, calves, sheep and hens and they also cultivate wheat and haricot. All the available resources are used for survival and nothing remains to invest in a business. So all Aghunik needs now is some financial resource to purchase two piglets, potato seeds and fuel for the cultivation works. 

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Aghunik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for two piglets, potato seeds and fuel for the cultivation work

loans.name: Dailyn

texts.en: Dailyn is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 2 years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. Dailyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Xiomara Esmeralda

texts.es:
Xiomara de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, ya no pudo continuar pues tuvo que buscar trabajo para ayudar a su familia, es madre soltera pero lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos.


Actualmente, Xiomara trabaja en una tienda, ya tiene dos años realizando esta actividad, además en sus días de descanso le ayuda a su padre en el trabajo del campo porque desde muy pequeña aprendió a cultivar la tierra, su horario de trabajo en la tienda es de 7:00 AM  a 3:00 PM y de esta manera llega temprano a su casa para atender a su familia.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar dos terneros para criarlos y que le sirvan para arar la tierra.

Su sueño es darles estudios a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y puedan tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 34 years old. She studied until ninth grade but could not continue because she had to find work to help her family. She is a single mother struggling to raise her children.

Currently, Xiomara works in a store where she worked for the past two years. On her days off, she helps her father with his farming because she learned to cultivate the land in her early childhood. Her working hours at the store is 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM so that she can go home early to care of her family.

Xiomara requests a loan to buy two calves to raise and for plowing. She hopes to give her children education to be professionals and to have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy two calves to raise and for plowing.

loans.name: José Irene

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, a pesar de que no pudo asistir a la escuela es una persona educada, trabajadora y responsable, está casado y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que depende de él.
 

José tiene mucho tiempo trabajando en la agricultura, lo que le ha servido para obtener experiencia y realizar un excelente trabajo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos necesarios para preparar la tierra y realizar la siembra.

Él sueña con cultivar tres hectáreas de maíz para aumentar sus ingresos e ir ahorrando para darle estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old, despite not being about to go to school, he is a decent person, hard-working and responsible.  José is married and has a six year old son who depends on him. 

José has been working in farming for a long time, this has given him experience and means that his work is excellent. He needs the loan to buy the necessary supplies to prepare the land and complete the planting of the seeds. 

José's dream is to plant three hectares of corn so that he can increase his earnings and save for his son's studies.

loans.use: to buy the necessary supplies to prepare the land and complete the planting of the seeds.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer has always loved and owned pets, so she decided to venture into the pet sitting business about five years ago. She began working as an independent contractor for various websites, such as DogVacay, Rover.com, and Care.com.

It was then that she forged a partnership with her soon-to-be friend, who initially saw Jennifer’s advertisement on Care.com. Jennifer realized that she was really good at pet sitting, so she registered her business name, “Hearts 4 Paws and Claws”, in July. Since that time, she has spent the majority of her efforts working on marketing her new business.

“The thing I like most about what I do is the way animals treat you with an abundance of love,” said Jennifer. “You could be in the worst mood, and they will make your whole day for the better.”

At this point, she has not had any of her own clients, although she continues to work as an independent contractor for her friend’s pet sitting company. She is working on marketing the business with the hope of creating a large base of her own clients. She has the drive to grow her business so that she can become more independent.

Her Kiva loan will be used to continue her marketing efforts and to purchase a tablet so that she can create a website. Jennifer not only has extensive experience in her field, but she also has her cat and dog CPR, and animal First Aid certifications, and a membership in Pet Sitters International. These certifications and her passion for the animals set her apart as a leader in her field.

“I want my clients to know that I would treat their pet as if it was my own,” stated Jennifer. “I have had some challenges in my life, but I have the drive to be successful.”

loans.use: to continue her marketing efforts and to purchase a tablet so that she has access to website creation.
